Proud to be a Brown graduate üë®‚Äçüéì and become a #Brunonian forever! I am thrilled and humbled to share that I graduated from Brown University with a master's in technology and leadership program this Memorial Day weekend!

As I proudly marched out of the iconic #VanWickle Gates, I reflected on the last one and a half years as an everlasting and extremely rewarding experience. I also reaffirmed the belief that when I am nervous and excited about something at the same time, I must do it!
Feeling accomplished and grateful to the awesome cohort, teachers, co-workers, family, friends, and Holman who supported me thru & thru on this journey successfully.

Leaving behind the all-nighters and looking forward to rolling on!!

We had such a great AAPI celebration! Purti Malhotra and Ashu Sharma did a fantastic job with the planning and facilitation. It was so heartwarming to hear other stories resonating with my own from, Aarthi Murali. Thankful to be part of the Holman family.

It was wonderful to speak about Humans and AI at Insurtech Insights in NYC with Aditi Javeri Gokhale. We talked about how leadership will evolve, where GenAi is and where it is going and how we as humans will live in this new world of agents and humans working together. And yes in the end we fear not and embrace this moment. We loved telling the story of our kids and how they are using AI! #tasksvsjobs #embracenotfear #humansandagents

That‚Äôs a wrap on Holman‚Äôs Potential Leader Program! Amazing cohort, met some truly awesome people.

Look forward to putting those sessions to good use!

NEWS ALERT üì∞üö®: The EU Parliament has just taken a significant step towards reducing single-use plastic waste in food and beverage packaging!

At NOMOQ, we're thrilled to see this progress towards a more sustainable future. And as advocates for a higher recycling rate in food and beverage packaging, we're aligned with the EU's vision for a circular economy.

In a similar move, Canada's Single-Use Plastics Prohibition Regulations aim to eliminate certain single-use plastics by 2030 to achieve zero plastic waste.

This news reaffirms our commitment to providing high-quality, fully recyclable cans for brands who share our passion for sustainability. How?

1Ô∏è‚É£ Our mission has always been to revolutionise digital can printing, making it accessible to beverage brands of all sizes. With our 'No Minimum Order Quantity' approach, we're breaking barriers and empowering creativity, while championing sustainability.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Our state-of-the-art technology transforms aluminium cans into stunning works of art, fully recyclable without labels or plastic sleeves. We are proud to be among the first globally, and the first in Europe, to pioneer this eco-friendly solution.

Stay tuned as we continue to lead the way in supplying decorated cans in small batch sizes for the beverage market. Together, let's create a more colourful and sustainable world, one can at a time.

üì∏ Here is a photo of some of our wonderful designs taken by the talented @tomas

üìù To read the full regulation, just check the comments


#Sustainability #CircularEconomy #NOMOQ #PackagingNews

Last week I graduated from The University of Nebraska with two master's degrees: an MBA with a finance specialization, and a Master of Science in Business Analytics.

This was an incredibly rewarding experience.¬†My roles in my 30+ year career have generally been highly technical.¬†Finance and Analytics were both interesting fields that I knew would make me better as a technical and operations leader.

My experience at Nebraska College of Business was outstanding.¬†When I first started looking at programs, I was primarily interested in curriculum, particularly in these areas of finance and analytics.¬†Which program included the classes that I thought I would enjoy taking?¬†Nebraska was the best choice for me easily, offering a great selection of classes and a dual degree program that allowed additional coursework in both areas of study that I was interested in.¬†¬†It is also a tremendous value ‚Äì having been ranked as high as #1 in the country for value among online MBA programs in recent years. I couldn‚Äôt agree more.

I‚Äôm very appreciative of the support I received (both generally and financially) by my employers: originally Ball Metalpack and then by acquisition Sonoco Products.  Both organizations have been incredibly supportive of continuing education.

The support from my family was awesome.¬†This was a demanding journey that I was trying to navigate ‚Äì with a wife and three young children at home, and a senior leadership role in my day job.¬†For the last four years, I dedicated 4am ‚Äì 6am every day + additional weekend hours as needed to my studies.

This entire experience was completed, start to finish, while I was in my 50‚Äôs.¬†I was almost always the oldest student in my classes and often older than the professor.¬†There were lots of opportunities to share professional experiences in these classes, and I like to think I brought many interesting ones to our discussions.

What next?¬†Well, 50-something years old is not too old to go back to school, and not too old to keep working at my most important job, as Dad.¬†Mallory and I will welcome our 4th child in the next few weeks, right before my 54th birthday!

If you‚Äôve been kicking around the idea of going back to school:¬†do it!¬†It‚Äôs never too late to keep learning!¬†I couldn‚Äôt be more excited about my path over the last few years.

 Finally ‚Äì if you‚Äôre worried that my years with Nebraska might have changed my college football priorities ‚Äì well, I always cheer for the Irish first on Saturday.¬†But when they aren‚Äôt playing‚Ä¶. GBR!

Adam Noble is a career technologist, honing his leadership mettle early on with organizations like UPS, Honeywell and Mars. He took is first VP position in the Shared Technology Application and Services office at JPMorganChase, and has since held SVP & CIO positions at GAF, Veritiv Corporation, American Water and now is the now Operating Partner of IT at Littlejohn & Co.

Adam has been a great friend and advocate for the HMG Strategy community for years. Congratulations to you for receiving a 2024 HMG LEGENDS Award at today's 16th Annual New Jersey C-Level Technology Leadership Summit!

column2: After 10+ years with Hershey, I have officially retired today. It‚Äôs been a great run. Time to play with the grand kids, play golf, play guitar, travel to far off and close by lands and learn another language, not necessarily in all that order. Sending a general thanks to those whom I‚Äôve met along this journey of life, especially those who lent a helping hand, offered an encouraging word, and those who were kind as well. I‚Äôm so grateful for so much, it‚Äôs truly humbling to see how much I‚Äôve been blessed. Perhaps our paths with still cross and we can enjoy a fine cocktail, glass of wine or whatever is your choice, as long as we get to spend time, person to person, it‚Äôs all good. Peace‚Ä¶

It was great to join Jim Cramer on CNBC‚Äôs Mad Money to discuss our stellar Q3 results and cybersecurity advancements. Legacy cybersecurity vendors are on the defensive worried about cannibalizing their firewall and VPN revenue. Zscaler continues to perform for our customers and our investors.

We also discussed how it's not only a business, but it‚Äôs a mission for us to protect over 40% of the Fortune 500 and federal agencies, like the DoD. 

Thank you, Jim, for having me on the show. It was great speaking with you again.

On Juneteenth, it‚Äôs important to reflect on how far we‚Äôve come as a country ‚Äî and as an electric utility industry ‚Äî to achieve diversity, equity and inclusion. It‚Äôs also important to recognize that simply commemorating the end of slavery in the United States is not enough. 

I‚Äôm here with Southern California Edison (SCE)‚Äôs Kristen Yee and Robert Preston Lloyd, participants in Edison Electric Institute‚Äôs Diverse and Emerging Leaders program, which provides networking opportunities and exposure to critical issues facing our business. Kristen and Robert are strong leaders who will help power the clean energy future. 

A special thanks to EEI‚Äôs Courtney A. Peterson, PCC for championing this program and leading our industry‚Äôs DEI efforts and strategies.
 
Edison International, Southern California Edison (SCE) and Trio are committed to fostering a culture of inclusion and belonging, where everyone can bring their whole selves to work.
 
#Juneteenth #freedomday #diversity #equity #inclusion #DEI

Ahead of Father‚Äôs Day this weekend, I want to take a moment to give a shoutout to all the fathers and father figures on our CXO team. 

As a father of three boys, I often think back to something my parents used to tell me, when I was their age: ‚ÄúIf you want to hoot with the owls, you need to be prepared to scream with the eagles!‚Äù In other words, enjoy your late nights, have some fun, but be ready to handle your responsibilities the next morning.

This lesson has stuck with me, and as I watch my boys grow into young men with their own interests and responsibilities, I see its importance even more clearly. It‚Äôs a principle that translates directly into our team culture and our success.¬†Managing family responsibilities and professional commitments can be challenging, but it‚Äôs that challenge that makes us stronger and more effective. 

Happy Father‚Äôs Day to all the dads out there. Your dedication and hard work inspires us all!

Last week during the Season 1 2025 LATAM Market Launch in Punta Cana, DR I was honored to receive the Crocs LATAM Person of the Decade Award. This recognition is a testament to the incredible team and colleagues I‚Äôve had the privilege to work with for the past thirteen years.

Thank you to each and every one of you for your unwavering support, dedication, and hard work. Together, we have achieved remarkable milestones and made a lasting impact. This award is as much yours as it is mine.

Here‚Äôs to many more years of collaboration and success!

#Teamwork #Gratitude #Achievement #CrocsLATAM #CrocsMexico

üéâ **Celebrating Team Excellence!** üéâ

I'm thrilled to share that our Crocs Mexico Team has achieved remarkable milestones this year at the S‚Äô25 Crocs LATAM Market Launch, earning recognition in several categories. These accomplishments are a testament to the dedication, hard work, and exceptional talent of our entire team.

üèÜ **Best Distributor Award**: Our distribution team has set a new benchmark in excellence, ensuring seamless and efficient delivery to all our partners.

The longest walkable distance in the world, is from Cape Town in South Africa to Magadan on Russia's eastern coast. The distance stretches 14,334 miles (23,068 kilometers).

Out and Back.

Today I hand over the P&G CIO responsibilities to Seth Cohen. I look forward to watching from afar to see how Seth and the team continue to take P&G‚Äôs digital capabilities to new heights.

I will finish an exciting and fulfilling journey with Procter & Gamble at the end of June, retiring from a career in IT which I started 39 years ago as Analyst Programmer.

Many people asked me what I am ‚Äúreally‚Äù going to do next.¬†I will still stay connected to the world of technology, however my main objective for the next chapter is to dedicate time to my family and myself.

I have many memories to take with me, but the ones I will treasure the most are related to the people I worked with.¬†I appreciate they shared the same passion for technology that drives business¬†outcomes, and I am grateful for their dedication, hard work, and commitment to excellence.

Above all, I am thankful for everything I learned from them, for the lessons I was taught and for the perspective I was given. I wish everybody the same opportunity¬†to learn and have fun as I had ‚Äì and more.

Roger, Over and Out,

Vittorio

As leaders we are only as good as our teams - leaders look tall because they are being carried by Giants. To my team of giants, I am so incredibly proud of all that we have achieved. You have punched way above your weight class & helped establish one of the best cyber/tech/3rd party/resilience/operational risk programs in the industry. You did it by advising business leaders on how to get to YES rather than saying NO. Thank you Gnana Chavali - especially for boot strapping our Center of Excellence (CoE), thanks Sandip Biswas, Richard Flood, Alain Gresse, David Smith, Dewayne Sharp.

To the global non-financial risk team, you defined what seamless & operating as one means. Your espirit de corps was the engine that drove the group. Each major crisis is different 9/11 to 2008 financial Meltdown to Covid, threats change from cyber/climate/AI. One thing I have learned over the years, is that risk is never constant & always shape shifting. What is constant & does not shift, is how an agile, data driven, team of risk professionals can help a firm overcome these crises & emerge stronger. You have done that and more. Thanks !!

Great to attend the National Flood Insurance Program FEMA Conference to understand flood risk to every property, how to make properties and communities more resilient and how to leverage AI to help achieve these goals.

At CoreLogic we leverage AI to innovate ‚Ä¶

Where every property attribute counts like first floor height (a major contributor to understanding flood risk in relation to the topology of the adjacent land)‚Ä¶

Where every pixel counts - where we use image analytics to identify wildfire resiliency factors on properties in California to reduce wildfire insurance premiums by up to 20% (e.g factors like fence is 12 feet away, no flammable materials within 5 feet and identifying enclosed roof eaves)

Where every property counts - use supercomputing to understand the financial risk to every property due to climate change ‚Ä¶ initially up the year 2050 - enables regulators to shape policy, investors/lenders assess risk, insurers price premiums and set resilency factors to reduce premiums.

This is CoreLogic 2.0

I am pleased to share an article published in the most recent Innovation Issue of the Indianapolis Business Journal that highlights AES Indiana's recent efforts to demonstrate how we can increase¬† grid capacity through innovative technologies.
 
The United States is experiencing a rapidly shifting energy landscape due to the rising use of electricity, including electric vehicles and big tech data centers, which highlight the need for energy production and delivery to keep pace with growing customer demand. At The AES Corporation, we‚Äôre piloting innovative projects, such as LineVision's Dynamic Line Ratings (DLR), to better understand how we can deliver more energy on the grid as safely and efficiently as possible.
 
You can read the full article where I share more about AES Indiana‚Äôs LineVision pilot project, initial findings, and key learnings so that we can get more value from our existing grid assets with improved information. This pilot project reinforces that innovation is a crucial component for a greener, safer, and more equitable energy future.
 
#AES #Innovation #SustainableEnergy

On Thursday, I had the pleasure of attending the Goldman Sachs Capital Markets conference in New York City. There, Stephen Dubner, co-author of Freakonomics, explained that, in a world where uncertainty and complexity prevail, it is crucial to approach predictions with humility. As Daniel Kahneman wrote in his book Thinking, Fast and Slow, "A plan for the future is an act of faith that cannot be based on certainty." Recognizing the limitations of our own knowledge and understanding can prevent us from falling victim to overconfidence and bias, allowing for more accurate and nuanced predictions. By maintaining a humble attitude towards our predictive abilities and leading with curiosity, we open ourselves up to learning from mistakes and adjusting our strategies accordingly. Ultimately, humility in prediction-making is not a sign of weakness, but rather a strength that leads to more thoughtful and insightful decision-making. 

What is your process or approach when making predictions?

I am so appreciative for the incredible number of supportive messages I‚Äôve gotten this past week for being named on the Modern Healthcare list of 50 Most Influential Clinical Executives.  Thank you to Modern HC for the honor. Thank you even more to my friends and colleagues at Elevance Health, who do such inspiring work on behalf of our members and communities.

I also want to highlight some people on the list I have the good fortune of knowing and are working on some of our biggest healthcare challenges. People like Sreekanth Chaguturu, Amar A. Desai, MD, MPH, Alexander Garza, Alice Hm Chen, Dora Hughes, Dr. Omar Lateef, Vivek Murthy, Jonathan Perlin, Jaewon Ryu, Neel Shah, Bruce Siegel, and Tunde Sotunde. They are all truly great leaders and I endeavor to learn from each of them.

And ‚Äî let‚Äôs be honest ‚Äî there are so many worthy clinical leaders and execs not on the list this year. For all of our problems in US healthcare, a paucity of smart, thoughtful clinical leaders is not one of them. We could fill a list of the next 50 leaders, the 50 after that, and the 50 after that, and on and on. I want to thank every clinical leader I have worked with, learned from, been in awe of. You all have brought a common sense, practical view to the rooms you are in and, most importantly, have represented the patients we have gotten to care for. Thank you for that and everything you do. Keep it up, and I will try everyday to follow your example.

We are incredibly proud to share that our Chief Product & Technology Officer, Gene German, has authored a groundbreaking article featured in Chief Healthcare Executive.

Gene‚Äôs article dives deep into the pivotal role of AI and prepayment #claims editing in revolutionizing payment accuracy and creating significant value for health plans.

üí° Key Takeaways:

üîπ AI‚Äôs Transformative Power: The integration of AI and predictive analytics is crucial for enhancing payment accuracy and reducing administrative costs.

üîπ Data-Driven Healthcare: As healthcare generates 30% of the world‚Äôs data, AI‚Äôs potential to harness this data for transformative solutions is immense.

üîπ Addressing Payment Challenges: Innovative AI tools are essential for tackling rising healthcare costs, administrative waste, and fraud.

üîπ Collaborative Innovation: Effective solutions arise from deep industry expertise and genuine partnerships, addressing specific challenges such as state Medicaid compliance and genetic testing claims.

Gene‚Äôs perspective underscores a critical shift in healthcare payment integrity towards prepay solutions, enabled by AI. This approach minimizes the need for costly post-payment interventions and fosters better payer-provider relationships.

As we navigate this dynamic landscape, it‚Äôs essential for industry leaders to embrace AI-driven solutions that not only improve efficiency but also enhance care quality.

The future of payment integrity will be defined by collaboration, innovation, and the strategic use of advanced technologies.

#HealthcareInnovation #PaymentIntegrity #healthplans

Yesterday at the NYSE, we commemorated the 25th Anniversary of Goldman Sachs‚Äô initial public offering. Joined by many of the original IPO team members, we had the honor of celebrating this pivotal moment in our firm‚Äôs history by recreating the bell ringing from 1999. 

As part of the celebration, I hosted a dinner with former chairman and CEO Hank Paulson for an audience of IPO alumni, leadership, and others who have been essential to the firm‚Äôs success over the years. Hank had an incredible journey ‚Äì beginning as an investment banker, rising to partner, and ultimately leading the firm‚Äôs transition into a publicly traded company in 1999. Under Hank‚Äôs guidance, Goldman Sachs navigated the IPO and expanded our global footprint, all while preserving our unique culture and partnership ethos.

Hank put it best: "We would not be Goldman Sachs if we didn't go public because you can't be Goldman Sachs unless you're dealing with the most important clients and markets, and that takes people and capital."¬†Thank you to Hank and all alumni for your vision and the extraordinary standard you set.¬†Commemorating this milestone with you.

As we come together to honor #Juneteenth, I am filled with gratitude for the visible support I am witnessing from my friends and colleagues. This day holds immense historical weight because it marks the emancipation of enslaved Black people in the United States. But it is just as important that the celebration is a testament to the progress occurring as part of the unwavering fight for equality.
 
As the challenging moments grow this year regarding the discussion of equality and rights, we should lean into our shared humanity to keep us unified. We should double our commitment to listening to each other‚Äôs lived experiences, while finding opportunities to highlight our similarities, and embrace the benefits¬†of diversity. Our collective strength lies in our ability to uplift one another, regardless of race, gender, culture, or orientation.
 
As a Senior Vice President at Sempra, I stand appreciative and humbly alongside you all. Let us continue this journey toward a better tomorrow, where every individual feels welcomed and thrives. Happy Juneteenth!

Year 2 of the ABA Stonier Graduate School of Banking is officially in the books.  Very excited to get home and see my family but it is amazing to be at The Wharton School in Philadelphia and learning alongside other great industry leaders.  Our group was also able to adequately manage our bank and win the Bank Exec simulation!

Boom!¬†So excited for the launch of the U.S. Bank and Greenlight partnership to support parents as they raise financially-smart kids.¬†Helping kids learn about money in a card and digitized payments world is challenging and that is the need the joint team tackled.

This first-of-its-kind collaboration provides eligible U.S. Bank clients with complimentary access to Greenlight (already trusted by over 6 million parents and kids)
1) Kids receive a physical debit card (with ability add to a mobile wallet) along with their own Greenlight app with additional features and lessons
2) Parents have visibility and control of the accounts for their children all within their existing U.S. Bank mobile app

This is an awesome joint effort across U.S. Bank and Greenlight to develop the concept and deploy using the Greenlight SDK.

Thank you to the team with special thanks to Tara O'Donnell for her commitment to drive this effort to execution.¬†Congratulations to the collective achievement of the teams ‚Äì product, digital, technology, risk, marketing, legal, and many others to attack a need and deliver a solution.

I have seen my own kids gain confidence and understanding from the Greenlight offering and am thrilled at how this collaboration with U.S. Bank can help many more parents and kids.

#Milwaukee fact: The Juneteenth Day Parade and Celebration is one of the largest and longest running #Juneteenth celebrations in the country.

I was able to commemorate the day and enjoy the parade‚Äôs 53rd year with thousands of others, including my colleagues from US Bank and one of our community leaders, Nina V.A. Johnson, MBA.

Juneteenth marks the official end of slavery in the United States. It‚Äôs a day to revisit the progress we‚Äôve made since and to celebrate the resilience, culture, and heritage of African Americans. Let‚Äôs continue building a world where we can honor our differences and bring our whole selves to everything we do.

I‚Äôve met a few noteworthy people in my life, but none of them have had a significant impact on me (personally or professionally). That all changed yesterday.

While waiting in the lobby to see my eye doctor, a man walks in and greets the staff like they are family. He laughed with everyone, knew everyone‚Äôs names, shared jokes with them, and treated them like his own.

When I first looked his way, I knew I recognized him. It looked like Richard Davis, but I didn‚Äôt want to say anything. For those of you that don‚Äôt know Richard Davis, he was the CEO of U.S. Bank during the financial crisis and how he led the company through it truly inspired me.

At that time, all major banks were roiling because of the market crash and the failures of multiple financial institutions. As strong as U.S. Bank was, the company was not immune to feeling the impacts. Instead of cutting jobs like many other banks were doing at the time, he offered a different solution. Everyone will take a 5% pay cut and nobody loses their job. I was just a 20 hour teller at the time while I was going to school. I really didn‚Äôt have any sense of how significant that idea was until I looked back on it. Everyone gave a little bit so that we could all make it through the hard times together. That last word, together, is the key part.

Mr. Davis‚Äô leadership and example has inspired me throughout my career. First and foremost he taught me that employees are not just numbers or financial burdens, they are the members of a work family and are the key to a successful business. Happy employees are more productive and ultimately produce better results. While at the helm of U.S. Bank, he truly believed in that philosophy and it permeated throughout every level of the organization.

Returning to my story from earlier, the office staff called him by name. ‚ÄúHey Rich!‚Äù At that moment, I knew it was, indeed, Richard Davis. I greeted him by name, he quickly stood up and shook my hand, and we shared a conversation. I also knew I couldn‚Äôt pass up an opportunity to get a photo with him. Obviously I wasn‚Äôt dressed the best, but who likes to go to the doctor in work clothes?

It was an honor to meet you, Mr. Davis!

Boom!¬†So excited for the launch of the U.S. Bank and Greenlight partnership to support parents as they raise financially-smart kids.¬†Helping kids learn about money in a card and digitized payments world is challenging and that is the need the joint team tackled.

This first-of-its-kind collaboration provides eligible U.S. Bank clients with complimentary access to Greenlight (already trusted by over 6 million parents and kids)
1) Kids receive a physical debit card (with ability add to a mobile wallet) along with their own Greenlight app with additional features and lessons
2) Parents have visibility and control of the accounts for their children all within their existing U.S. Bank mobile app

This is an awesome joint effort across U.S. Bank and Greenlight to develop the concept and deploy using the Greenlight SDK.

Thank you to the team with special thanks to Tara O'Donnell for her commitment to drive this effort to execution.¬†Congratulations to the collective achievement of the teams ‚Äì product, digital, technology, risk, marketing, legal, and many others to attack a need and deliver a solution.

I have seen my own kids gain confidence and understanding from the Greenlight offering and am thrilled at how this collaboration with U.S. Bank can help many more parents and kids.

It's week two of summer break in our household. And that means we're in full swing of summer sports, camps and lake time with my three kids.¬†My entryway is a sign of the times, piled high with Crocs, sports gear and swim goggles.

While I love summer (who doesn't in the Land of 10,000 Lakes), I have to admit it requires a serious shift in my mindset as a working parent. The mental gymnastics required to manage all the logistics of who is going where and when is real - and some days it feels like a part-time job! And don't get me started on managing the budget for ice cream, Starbucks and Culvers runs.

At Brillect, we have several (and might I add rock star) consultants who have opted to take the summers off.¬†Some of them have done it for years; others are trying it for the first time this summer. But the common thread between all of them is that taking the summers off is a win for them, their families and our clients.

I believe that work life integration comes in all shapes, sizes and seasons. Finding that right-size role starts with listening to what people need in order to thrive at work + in life. Because there's more to us than our job titles.

We're a company made up of triathletes, pilots, pickleball fanatics, canoe craftsman and yes, parents who are juggling all the things in the busy summer season.

Some people may want the time off to care for children while others have booked a bucket list trip or want to finish a passion project.

No matter what the reason, we keep our focus on the whole person - not just the work person - to shape a career that recognizes where they're at in life.

Here's to summer and finding time for all the things that bring us joy.

#WorkLife #Summer #WorkingParent

Clip is the leading payment platform providing comprehensive solutions for both digital transactions and point-of-sale devices. The company is continually innovating, and exploring new technologies such as artificial intelligence and machine learning to enhance its offerings.

Clip has raised $100 million from Morgan Stanley Tactical Value and another West Coast investor. The fresh funding keeps the valuation in line with the¬†Series D round, which valued the company at $2 billion.

Clip, Mexico City,¬†Distrito Federal,¬†Mexico, was founded in 2012 by Adolfo Babatz and Vilash Poovala. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs a lot of money waiting to be invested in good, high quality companies that are delivering results,‚Äù noted Adolfo Babatz. ‚ÄúI think that‚Äôs our case. We‚Äôre happy to share this news with the broader tech community both in Mexico and in Latin America, which I think is in need of some really good news.‚Äù Clip is expanding its reach, exploring opportunities to enter new markets, and bringing its solutions to more businesses across Latin America.

‚ÄúProfessionalism‚Äù is often used to sideline LGBTQ people.

‚ÄúI hear from a lot of trans and gender nonconforming people, dress code is often used as a smokescreen to justify homophobia and transphobia," says artist and public speaker ALOK Vaid-Menon.

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs still this idea that our appearance is conflated with our legitimacy...with our ability to do a good job," ALOK says. "We need to disentangle that."

ALOK says that often queer or trans people are penalized or punished for being "visibility emotional, visibly queer, visibly trans in the workplace." They say, don't underestimate that, but also don't underestimate the power of queer and trans leadership in the workplace.

"It begins with an individual saying, 'I‚Äôm not going to tolerate this,' and recognizing that creates ramifications and reverberations for all people."

Watch Andrew Seaman's full interview with ALOK: https://lnkd.in/g82Nb9Jq

As a founder, I often get asked ‚Äì how did you come up with your company name?   While I typically use this to crack some dumb dad-joke, the reality is the name will find you.

When we named XUP (pronounced ‚Äòzup‚Äô), it was after whiteboarding up a thousand plus names, multiple languages and meanings‚Ä¶but what really happened is someone was being funny and then an unfortunate spelling mistake that led to the name. Eventually, we came up with the ‚Äòpublic‚Äô story which was the ‚ÄúX‚Äù stood for transactions and we drive them UP! So XUP!

Now that we‚Äôre on to pAIwares (pronounced pay-wares), it was MUCH easier. We knew AI was going to be on the platform, we were software and in payments‚Ä¶so after a few URL availability searches, pAIwares.com was available and it stuck. Okay, we had one teammate who didn‚Äôt like it, but he eventually came around.

Some say naming your company is exciting while others say it‚Äôs daunting. Either way, pick one that you can get behind with an available URL, and don‚Äôt be afraid of people not pronouncing it correctly. As long as they‚Äôre calling you something close, you‚Äôre in the game.

How about your company - how did you choose your name?  Comment below - curious about everyone's experiences!

Starting the week with this very thoughtful HBR article. Great read. My biggest takeaways-

üí™ ‚Ä¶move beyond promoting those with the most competence and start thinking more about those who can get you where you want to go.
üí™‚Ä¶start considering those who have high potential, not just top performers.
üí™‚Ä¶biggest assumption, attributes that have made someone successful so far will continue to make them successful in the future. Not true anymore. 
üí™‚Ä¶successful leaders remain open to adapt and continually learn. It‚Äôs what I call the #3Astrategy. Adjust, Adapt and Accomplish.
üí™‚Ä¶every company needs different types of leaders at different times, and someone who performs well in their current role may not be the right person to help you reach your most immediate goals.

So what‚Äôs your top takeaway after you read this piece? Thanks in advance for sharing and building on our learnings. 

#PRBossLady #leadership #thrivenotsurvive #3AStrategy #collectivelearning

Takeaways:
‚Ä¢	Based on McKinsey‚Äôs research, companies with leading digital capabilities outperform those that are behind by two to six times on total shareholder returns.¬†Great stat, but something that tech providers need to focus on in their individual projects is ùê≠ùê´ùêöùêßùê¨ùê•ùêöùê≠ùê¢ùêßùê† ùê≠ùê°ùêöùê≠ ùê†ùêûùêßùêûùê´ùêöùê•, ùêöùê©ùê©ùê•ùêû ùê©ùê¢ùêû ùê¨ùê≠ùêöùê≠ùê¢ùê¨ùê≠ùê¢ùêú ùê¢ùêßùê≠ùê® ùê°ùê≤ùê©ùêûùê´-ùê´ùêûùê•ùêûùêØùêöùêßùê≠ ùê≠ùêûùê´ùê¶ùê¨ their customer can get excited about and help them measure and prove the value.
‚Ä¢	McKinsey identifies six capability areas necessary for transformation:¬†1) Strategy, 2) Talent, 3) Operating Model, 4) Technology, 5) Data, and 6) Adoption and Scaling.¬†The descriptions of each of these begin to clarify why digital transformation is so hard.¬†Each area, taken on its own, is a big lift, and to truly achieve lasting competitive advantage, a business must address all six (‚ÄúCompanies don‚Äôt necessarily need to be exceptional in every capability, but they do need to hit a baseline of competency across all of them.‚Äù)¬†Truly developing a core competence around digital and AI is what I like to call a ‚Äúhigh degree of difficulty vault.‚Äù¬†High risk and high reward.¬†Again, ùê©ùê´ùê®ùêØùê¢ùêùùêûùê´ùê¨, ùê∞ùê°ùêöùê≠ ùê©ùê´ùê®ùêùùêÆùêúùê≠ùê¨ ùêöùêßùêù ùê¨ùêûùê´ùêØùê¢ùêúùêûùê¨ ùêúùêöùêß ùê≤ùê®ùêÆ ùê©ùê´ùê®ùêØùê¢ùêùùêû ùê≠ùê°ùêöùê≠ ùê•ùê®ùê∞ùêûùê´ ùê≠ùê°ùêû ùê´ùê¢ùê¨ùê§?
‚Ä¢	Of the six capabilities, McKinsey says, ‚ÄúIt is telling that the largest gaps are in creating a strategic road map to realize value and in adoption and scaling, as opposed to in technology:¬†ùêõùêûùê¢ùêßùê† ùê¨ùêÆùêúùêúùêûùê¨ùê¨ùêüùêÆùê• ùê¢ùêß ùêùùê¢ùê†ùê¢ùê≠ùêöùê• ùêöùêßùêù ùêÄùêà ùê¢ùê¨ ùê•ùêûùê¨ùê¨ ùêöùêõùê®ùêÆùê≠ ùê≠ùêûùêúùê°ùêßùê®ùê•ùê®ùê†ùê¢ùêúùêöùê• ùê≠ùê®ùê®ùê•ùê¨ ùêöùêßùêù ùê¶ùê®ùê´ùêû ùêöùêõùê®ùêÆùê≠ ùê°ùê®ùê∞ ùê∞ùêûùê•ùê• ùêõùêÆùê¨ùê¢ùêßùêûùê¨ùê¨ ùê•ùêûùêöùêùùêûùê´ùê¨ ùêöùê•ùê¢ùê†ùêß ùê≠ùê°ùêûùê¢ùê´ ùê®ùê´ùê†ùêöùêßùê¢ùê≥ùêöùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß.‚Äù¬†Ding ding ding.
‚Ä¢	The most important point:¬†As the authors write, ‚ÄúUnderstanding what to do is one thing‚Ä¶these capabilities are well known to most executives.¬†Understanding how to actually build those capabilities is another.‚Äù¬†Yes.¬†This is a massive opportunity for tech providers.¬†How can we more safely lead our clients through to realization of the value of technology?¬†We don‚Äôt need more/better thought leadership ‚Äì we all get it!¬†ùêàùê¶ùêöùê†ùê¢ùêßùêû ùê≠ùê°ùêû ùêØùêöùê•ùêÆùêû ùêüùê®ùê´ ùêö ùêúùê•ùê¢ùêûùêßùê≠ ùê¢ùêß ùêö ùê©ùê´ùê®ùêØùê¢ùêùùêûùê´ ùê≠ùê°ùêöùê≠ ùêúùêöùêß ùêúùê•ùêûùêöùê´ùê•ùê≤ ùê¢ùêùùêûùêßùê≠ùê¢ùêüùê≤ ùêöùêßùêù ùê¶ùê¢ùê≠ùê¢ùê†ùêöùê≠ùêû ùê≠ùê°ùê®ùê¨ùêû ùê´ùê¢ùê¨ùê§ùê¨ ùêöùêßùêù ùê©ùêöùê´ùê≠ùêßùêûùê´ ùê∞ùê¢ùê≠ùê° ùê≠ùê°ùêûùê¶ ùê≠ùê® ùê≠ùê´ùêÆùê•ùê≤ ùêöùêúùê°ùê¢ùêûùêØùêû ùê•ùêöùê¨ùê≠ùê¢ùêßùê† ùêúùê®ùê¶ùê©ùêûùê≠ùê¢ùê≠ùê¢ùêØùêû ùêöùêùùêØùêöùêßùê≠ùêöùê†ùêû ùê≠ùê°ùê´ùê®ùêÆùê†ùê° ùêùùê¢ùê†ùê¢ùê≠ùêöùê• ùê≠ùê´ùêöùêßùê¨ùêüùê®ùê´ùê¶ùêöùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß.

ü§ú Mental Health is EVERYONE's business.
ü§ú It's not a taboo. 
ü§ú We should talk about it more openly‚Äîat home, in the workplace, and within our communities.

As the newly appointed National Board Director for NAMI, the National Alliance on Mental Illness, I commit to using my skills and lived experiences to create awareness for mental health issues, advocate for stronger policies & support system to help improve the lives of individuals and families affected by mental illness.

Grateful for this opportunity and looking forward to partnering with the amazing Dan Gillison, his executive team, my fellow board members, and all the amazing volunteers who make NAMI's work possible.

Let's continue to break the stigma. Together, we can make a difference.

Dan Gillison Pooja S. Mehta, MPH Devika Bhushan, MD Dhanu Sannesy Cathryn Nacario Joseph Gatto Darien Wright 

#MentalHealth #NAMI #BoardMember #Advocacy #MentalHealthMatters #PRBosslady

üåü Exciting Times at Atlas School! üåü

I recently had the privilege of attending a fireside chat at Atlas School, hosted by Aaron Smith, M.Ed. and featuring insightful discussions with industry leaders from BOK Financial: Garrett Guthrie, CDR, Amy Brown, Brent Lewis, and Sean Medlin. This event was a fantastic opportunity to network and learn about the future of technology and banking.

Key Takeaways:

üè¶ Community-Driven Banking: The speakers highlighted the importance of local initiatives, starting right here in Tulsa.

üöÄ Innovative Projects: From supporting consumer and mobile web development to introducing new features that set them apart from competitors, the focus is on staying modern and effective over the next 10-15 years. Critical milestones include the modernization of payment infrastructure and addressing technical debt within the software engineering team.

üè¢ Data Center Modernization: A significant three-year initiative to modernize data centers.

üõ°Ô∏è Challenges:

#Cybersecurity: Developers are being trained in secure coding practices, making cybersecurity the top priority across the bank.

#FraudDetection: Dedicated teams are continuously monitoring for fraudulent activities.

#AIUtilization: Emphasizing the responsible use of AI.

üõ†Ô∏è Skills Focus:

Technical Skills: Importance of real #problemSolving skills in technical interviews, rather than mere memorization.

Soft Skills: Not to be overlooked, with a focus on #authenticity and the ability to #mentor the next generation.

üíº Interview Insights:

Constantly evaluate if the role is the right fit, treating the interview process as a two-way street.

Success in the first 60-90 days involves building relationships.

üî• This event was an incredible learning experience, and I am grateful for the opportunity to connect with such inspiring professionals from BOK Financial. A big thank you to the Career Services department for organizing this insightful session. Looking forward to applying these insights in my own career journey!

#Networking #FiresideChat #TechInnovation #Cybersecurity #CareerGrowth #AtlasSchool #CommunityBanking #BOKFinancial

A huge thank you to Garrett Guthrie, CDR, Amy Brown, Brent Lewis, and Sean Medlin for coming to campus today and participating in a Fireside Chat! I enjoyed their insight about Bank of Oklahoma's efforts to modernize their platforms through innovation and technology. Their discussion was extremely insightful and I look forward to having them and Bank of Oklahoma on campus again soon!

I am so proud Bank of Oklahoma could provide a major gift to advance the new Rudisill Regional Library.  BOK Harmony Hall will provide a 400 seat auditorium important for building and maintaining community.

Just yesterday, I attended an inspiring Fireside Chat at Atlas School, hosted by Aaron Smith, M.Ed. The event featured insightful discussions with industry leaders from BOK Financial, including Garrett Guthrie, CDR, Amy Brown, Brent Lewis, and Sean Medlin. It was a fantastic opportunity to network and gain insights into the future of technology and banking.

BOK Financial is a prime example of community-driven banking, with a strong focus on local initiatives in Tulsa. The speakers discussed various innovative projects, emphasizing their commitment to consumer and mobile web development. They highlighted their efforts to introduce features that distinguish them from their competitors and shared their vision for staying modern and effective over the next 15 years. Their focus on modernizing payment processes and API integration strategies, along with their proactive approach to addressing technical debt within the software engineering team, was impressive as well. I value how they highlighted the significance of both soft and technical skills, emphasizing that it goes beyond memorization.

I'm thankful for the chance to attend a school that helps forge connections with top companies like BOK Financial in the Tulsa tech scene. Their groundbreaking work in banking technology truly inspires me, and I appreciate the opportunity to learn more about their company.

#AtlasSchool #Networking #BOKFinancial #Software #CyberSecurity #TechInnovation

column2: 7 years ago, I decided to leave a corporate job and bought an RV campground.  You may be wondering...how did that go?  There are aspects I miss about my IT Career, such as a great network of professionals, the deployment of technology to solve business problems, and the challenges of working in a highly competitive environment.  And of course, there are difficulties in owning a campground.  While in the corporate world, there were times I had to clean up other people's crap, it can be more literal in an RV campground ü§¢.  All said our business provides a service to guests that they love, I work alongside my family daily and run my own business how I see fit.  I have been very blessed by this adventure and I hope that you are in your own adventure no matter where you toil daily.

column2: UBC
UBC is at the forefront of finding creative ways to put #patientsfirst!

Meet Antoinette Messulam-Defaux. She has worked in Pharmacovigilance since 2011, leading all aspects of clinical trials, post-marketing, and medical device safety.  In her current role as Associate Director, Global Case Processing, she coordinates PV system set up, ensuring a seamless transition of PV activities and data migration into the UBC safety database.  Click here to learn more. https://hubs.li/Q02y98Xd0

#DIA üëèüòéFantastic day 1 in San Diego! 
Great to meet my US colleagues Brett Huselton Joe Devine Eric Hauser Anthony W. Luttenberger Aya S. Ryann Baudin Nathan Thompson Amber Frasketi JB Flinders, PhD, MBA and our CEO Bekki Bracken Brown looking forward to catching up with everyone on day 2 üßç‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüßçüßç‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

The past 13 months at Flatiron Health has been amazing.¬†Even after 25 years in the industry, I learned a ton and have met and collaborated with some amazing folks here.‚Äù¬†Although it has been a joy creating and driving the Scientific Engagement team at Flatiron, I have chosen to step away at this time.¬†There are a handful of factors, but the driving decision was a combination of some parental health issues that I‚Äôd like to actively help support through the next few months (hopefully to stabilization) and the fact that it aligned with some strategic Flatiron objectives in their timeline.¬†What I‚Äôm really going to miss most is the day-to-day work with Eric Meadows Jenna Collins Craig Serra and Kristi M. Zimmerman Savill, but it‚Äôs a small world and I have a feeling we‚Äôll all cross paths again.¬†I also want to especially thank Javier Jimenez and Stephanie Reisinger for bringing me into the Flatiron team - this was a tremendous experience.¬†I also want to thank the Executive team, and especially Nathan Hubbard, for allowing me to help shape the Flatiron scientific structure and ensuring that all these critical decisions supported Flatiron‚Äôs optimal path forward. 

I plan to take the month or two off from full-time Epidemiology work and instead, roll up my sleeves to provide some caregiving to my parents and hopefully also give my kids more of my time than they probably even want this summer and helping to develop some good core memories. 

In a perfect world, I will be looking to jump back into full-time work by mid/late August (hopefully in time to attend ISPE) and I‚Äôm absolutely open to discussion on what that work might be (epidemiology, data strategy, drug safety, CSO, etc.) as I do not have anything definitely lined up for my next role.

If you have any ideas or want to talk about how I may be able to help you/your organization, I'm all ears.  I look forward to speaking to many of you soon!

Increase efficiency and reduce the costs of high-volume PV case processing.  Read UBC's PV Case Automation Platform Case Study for insight into the automation of mailbox management, case intake, translation management, work assignment and more...

Need a real-time, user-friendly pharmacovigilance (PV) analytics solution that allows simple data visualization? Use our PV Tableau Data Analytics Platform dashboard system for comprehensive, readily accessible PV oversight for regulatory submissions, partner distribution compliance, case quality and more. Get the details: https://hubs.li/Q02B7RpH0

#PatientsFirst #Pharmacovigilance #SafetyandRiskManagement #PatientSafety #PVAnalytics

It's the final day of DIA's Global Annual Meeting! Meet UBC at booth 2201 to get a live demo of our pharmacovigilance analytics platform or discuss our approach to modernized study designs. Learn more or contact our team directly at https://hubs.li/Q02Cm0Lh0

#PatientsFirst #DIA2024 #Pharma #PatientSafety

Have you considered incorporating RWD/RWE in your integrated evidence strategy? The recent FDA draft guidance on confirmatory evidence paves the way for the inclusion of RWD/RWE to support drug effectiveness studies. Partner with UBC to develop an evidence generation strategy that can improve regulatory review to help bring safe and effective treatments to patients. Download our white paper to learn more: https://hubs.li/Q02xX_920

#PatientsFirst #RWE #RealWorldEvidence #RWD #RealWorldData

This week¬†WWT¬†had the honor of meeting at NVIDIA headquarters with the NVIDIA leadership team along CEO Jensen Huang. What a fun and productive visit! 

Our discussion covered unique AI developments across manufacturing, financial services, healthcare and life sciences, and delved into NVIDIA's significant contributions to our World Wide Technology Advanced Technology Center AI Proving Ground. This unique lab environment, leading the industry, is where our customers and partners experiment, test, and innovate with the latest AI hardware, software, and reference architectures in a secure, scalable, and transparent manner. Thanks to NVIDIA's groundbreaking hardware and software in the WWT ATC, AI transformation is becoming a reality for our customers. 
 
Our partnership with NVIDIA, marked by a shared focus on AI innovation and business transformation, has grown significantly over the years and continues to shape the future of AI. The advancements we are making for our customers is truly remarkable and we're positioned to create an even greater positive impact in the future. We look forward to¬†continuing this journey of innovation and transformation together! column2:
What an amazing week last week at Edison Electric Institute's 2024 conference.  It was the first time I attended this conference and will definitely be back!  Special thanks to Pedro Pizarro, Maria Pope, Calvin Butler, Dan R. Brouillette and the rest of the EEI Board for hosting Jensen Huang and me for a very thought-provoking lunch, followed by a great fireside chat between Pedro and Jensen discussing the future of Energy and the role #AI will play. 

So many great discussions with utility leaders and especially enjoyed my panel discussion with Hema Sundaram, Neva Espinoza, Maria Robinson hosted by Mary Sprayregen on AI: The Next Big Opportunity for Collaboration.  It was clear that utilities will benefit from open industry specific generative AI models that can be leveraged to help the entire industry move faster towards meeting our clean energy goals. 

AI is poised to revolutionize the utilities sector in numerous ways. By harnessing the power of AI, utilities can optimize grid management, enhance predictive maintenance, and improve demand forecasting. AI algorithms can analyze vast amounts of data in real-time, allowing for quicker decision-making and more efficient resource allocation. This leads to increased operational efficiency, reduced costs, and enhanced reliability of energy supply. Additionally, AI can facilitate the integration of renewable energy sources by predicting their availability and managing their intermittency, thus supporting the transition to a cleaner and more sustainable energy future.

Generative AI will play a crucial role in this transformation. Gen AI can create advanced predictive models and simulations, enabling utilities to better anticipate and prepare for various scenarios. It can also automate complex processes, reducing human error and freeing up resources for more strategic tasks. Furthermore, Gen AI can enhance customer engagement by providing personalized recommendations and solutions, thus improving customer satisfaction and loyalty. The potential of Gen AI in driving innovation and efficiency in the utilities sector is immense and will be a key factor in achieving our clean energy goals.

Was also excited to see the team from Deloitte and Utilidata announce a partnership to scale the Karmen distributed AI platform.   A software defined grid is a sustainable grid.  An open platform like Karmen allows for third party players to join in helping provide innovative applications that will reduce costs to rate payers while providing more resilient, reliable, secure and sustainable operations.

Portland General Electric/Southern California Edison (SCE)/Exelon/EPRI/U.S. Department of Energy (DOE)/NVIDIA/Jay Sungu/Ahsan Yousufzai/Dave Gibson/Shawntia McNeil , MBA/World Wide Technology/

After yet another impactful GridTECH Connect Forum, I want to share my gratitude to our amazing team, advisory board members, speakers, sponsors, and attendees who made this such an impactful event. Here are some parting thoughts after saying goodbye to Newport Beach: 

ü§ù There is an undeniable, shared desire among #utilities, #cleanenergy developers, and regulators to collaborate on the critical choke points facing the #energytransition. 

One of my favorite quotes of the week came from Vistra Corp.'s Cathleen Colbert: "I think about this like a ship. You can't just turn a ship on a dime." 

On that front, it was great to see California ISO and California Public Utilities Commission so well-represented across the event. Big thank you to Jill Powers and Gabe Petlin for making this happen.

‚òÄ California is a global leader in fighting #climatechange, but there's much work to be done. One of our keynote speakers, Scale Microgrids co-founder Tim Hade, made the case that "Climate action is war, and California is Normandy." Check out this recap of his remarks here: https://lnkd.in/eYaqyTHf

‚è∞ We don't have time to continue working in silos. Southern California Edison (SCE) exec Shinjini Menon acknowledged that collaboration is the only way we can achieve our lofty #climate goals: ‚ÄúWhat got us here will not get us to where we need to go."

Today Anterix proudly welcomes Oncor as the 7th utility joining us to deploy 900 MHz private broadband networks, now covering 15 states (and growing).¬†Oncor‚Äôs decision to deploy a private secure wireless broadband network again highlights the benefits of this technology for utilities, their customers, and the grid, and it also validates our goal of becoming a trusted partner to the entire energy ecosystem. With our current and future utility customers, our Utility Strategic Advisory Board, the incredibly innovative technology leaders in our Anterix Active Ecosystem, and the ongoing collaborative work with the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE)‚Äôs National Labs, we collectively are driving an evolution of our Nation‚Äôs grid.
We look forward to working with Oncor and with other Texas utilities, including our customers Xcel Energy and LCRA, to support energy resilience, security, and reliability across the entire state of Texas.

June Gold Star of the Month is Bailey Madison Bancroft, also known as Maddie. She lost her father, Marine Captain Matthew Bancroft, when he was killed in action during a deployment to Pakistan in 2002. Maddie shares her experiences with the Folded Flag Foundation by saying, ‚ÄúI am profoundly grateful to the Folded Flag Foundation for the support that they have provided me with and the opportunities I have because of their generosity. This scholarship program holds a dear place in my heart and helps me succeed in working toward my dreams. When I was eight months old, my dad passed away while serving in the Marine Corps. My mom was left having to raise me, along with my two brothers, and it is something that I know was not easy for her. We feel blessed for the patronage we are given. The Folded Flag Foundation has helped us tremendously with my being able to attend college. At USD, I studied in a neurobiology lab, worked as a pre-health peer mentor, and was president of the Neuroscience Club! In the Fall of 2024, I plan to attend physician assistant school to become a PA. Through my experiences at the University of San Diego (USD), I am passionate about my academics and future career and highly grateful for the wonderful relationships I have formed with my peers and professors. I graduated in May of 2024, but I can only recognize this accomplishment by acknowledging the generosity that I have been supported by with Folded Flag Foundation. We are so thankful for all that you do, not only for me but also for every other child who has gone through the hardship of losing a parent.‚Äù

I‚Äôm excited to share that I have been promoted to Senior Business Performance Analyst at Dominion Energy! Thank you to my mentors and colleagues at Dominion Energy for their unwavering support.

Yesterday at the Women‚Äôs Conference, I was honored to receive the SHEro award for Equity. This award is given to someone who has worked to promote and advance equity in the workplace. To be nominated and recognized by some of my peers for this has been an incredibly humbling (and surreal!) experience.

The women‚Äôs conference has been the most inspiring 2 days, and I take home with me so many kernels of wisdom for my professional and personal life. I am so honored to work alongside such thoughtful individuals, who aside from their day to day work, take on more to make the workplace and employees better. 

I think Maria Pia Tamburri said it best on day 1 of the women‚Äôs conference, when after her interview at Dominion Energy, she went home and told her husband that Dominion had good people. I echo this thought: Dominion has good people to work with and great people to know. I‚Äôm so fortunate to call so many of my colleagues my friends.

Lastly, a special shout out to my DEV Operations Support team who rallied for the occasion! I‚Äôve never felt so celebrated by my peers and my leadership. I‚Äôve received such an outpouring of support throughout the process. There is truly no better team out there!

Our teammates at Ladysmith, Roanoke Rapids and Gaston power stations are doing incredible work. It was great to visit the stations and see everyone‚Äôs enthusiasm as they talked about our investments in reliability and the environment. We are upgrading our combustion turbines at Ladysmith to increase megawatt output and flexibility. We have also upgraded the control systems at Roanoke Rapids and Gaston, and we have completed projects that protect the passage of eels and fish. I love that our team is committed to our mission ‚Äì and constantly generating new ideas to improve our operations!

May 22, 2024 was truly a monumental day for Dominion Energy.  This date marked the installation of the first monopile foundation with 170+ to follow through 2026 for the Coastal Virginia Offshore Wind project (CVOW).   These monopiles are nearly the height of the Statue of Liberty and the Washington Monument combined!

When completed, this wind facility will provide clean energy to 660,000 customers; thereby, eliminating millions of tons of carbon dioxide emissions annually. 

Thanks to all the project managers, engineers, technical and environmental specialists, supply chain, legal, accounting and many others who are dedicating their time to this project. 

Some companies talk about making a difference for the future, other companies take the bold steps to make it happen!

Proud to work at a company that takes bold steps to make our tomorrows cleaner and better!!!!

"When persistence meets innovation, even the smallest steps can lead to great success.


In a world filled with challenges, the story of the crow dropping stones into a jar to raise the water level teaches us a profound lesson: persistence and innovation can overcome even the toughest obstacles. ü™®üíß

Just like the crow, we often face situations where the solution isn't immediately apparent. However, with determination and a bit of creative thinking, we can find ways to reach our goals. Each stone the crow drops might seem insignificant on its own, but together, they make a significant impact. This reminds us that small, consistent efforts can lead to remarkable achievements over time. üê¶üöÄ

So, whenever you feel stuck or overwhelmed, remember the crow and its clever strategy. Keep pushing forward, think outside the box, and never underestimate the power of perseverance. Every step you take brings you closer to success. üåüüåç

Follow meüëâ Jerin Hossain for a daily dose of inspiration and wisdom üôè

#inspiration #leadership #kindness
#socialmedia #jerinlovescreatures

‚õàÔ∏è Strong storms ripped through parts of central Illinois Thursday, damaging over 30 transmission lattice structures just outside of Bloomington. Our dedicated lineworkers are working to safely make repairs and restore power in the area. 

As the summer storm season progresses in our area, these weather events emphasize our need to continue strategic investments that modernize our grid to withstand severe weather caused by climate change year-round.

We're incredibly honored to welcome Mark Baranek Senior Vice President of Technical Services at ComEd, to the Meals on Wheels Chicago Board of Directors!
 
Mark's dedication to our mission goes far beyond his impressive title. For years, he's been a true supporter to Meals on Wheels Chicago. From coordinating employee volunteers to cheering us on at galas and golf outings, Mark's passion for supporting our mission shines through.
 
Recently, Mark organized a company volunteer effort where he stood in as a "sous chef," helping teach seniors how to make healthy recipes. This hands-on involvement highlights his dedication to our cause, going above and beyond to not only organize the event but also directly contribute to its success.
 
But it's Mark's own words that truly capture his heart: "I am excited to join the board and bring my leadership skills to further the mission of Meals on Wheels Chicago. This organization holds a special place in my heart, and I look forward to making a positive impact."
 
Mark, we are thrilled to welcome you to the Meals on Wheels Chicago family! Together, with your leadership and the continued support of our community, we can ensure nutritious meals and independence for Chicago's homebound seniors and people with disabilities.

I wish everyone a Happy Pride Month.  At this time in our history it is as important as ever for employers to recognize that organizational diversity leads to more informed decision making, a cohesive workforce  and better economic outcomes.

As we celebrate Pride Month I encourage you to educate and bring along those who oppose the tenants of this month long celebration; inclusion, acceptance, joy, belonging, diversity.  These projectors of supposed 'virtue', who exist in most organizations and societies and who we all unfortunately have contact with, are the creators of exclusionary constructs that want to control you, maintain power and exert self-righteous mores rather than partner, grow and develop you as an individual.  They exist to the detriment of social, corporate and organizational cohesion.  Projected virtue in this sense is merely the marriage of caution and hypocrisy.  Speak openly about this hypocrisy to reveal to them and the world that  diversity is the reality of the human condition, even when they don't want to see it.  We are more successful as a species and a society when the full rainbow is seen!

Be Vocal

Be Visible

Be Yourself

column2:
I'm reflecting on my experience at the Analytics Leadership Consortium (ALC) Summit, hosted by the International Institute for Analytics in collaboration with the Cleveland Clinic - and here are my key takeaways:

First - CAO Albert Marinez shared that the value in data & analytics at their institution is recognized by leaders beyond his sphere, quoting their CEO Tom, "Data are the vital signs of the organization." D&A at the Clinic is viewed as a shared enterprise service; leaders like Albert work hard to engage everyone with their data and assets, recognizing the power it holds for its 81,000 global caregivers/workforce.

Second - while prioritizing speed alone has led some companies into irreversible consequences, the Clinic champions good governance as a means to accelerate AI innovation. (Joseph Dorocak, ASA, MAAA & Kevin Mooney, Esq.) From embedding principles into model development to developing enforceable standards, their deep dive was invaluable.

Third - we covered quite a bit of ground, from implementing ethical AI frameworks and integrating GenAI into existing roadmaps, to quantum computing (that's Jack Phillips & I in front of IBM Quantum System One) and VR training as a means to up-skill on the "soft stuff" (read: communication skills) in healthcare. Many questions remain for me, but this is the one that's loudest right now: How does a large, complex organization adhere to varying (EU, USA, etc.) regulatory mandates across its global presence AND accomplish some form of standardization?

TL;DR? This is your reminder to separate the signal from the noise. Cleveland Clinic is a beacon of forward-thinking in healthcare analytics.

üëè Special thanks to Albert Marinez, Andrew Proctor, Lisa Teti, James Simon MD, MBA, Kevin Mooney, Esq., Randy Geise, and all of the incredible leaders whose contributions made this Summit truly exceptional.

-MM

#AnalyticsLeadership #ALCSummit #DataAnalytics #HealthcareInnovation #AIInHealthcare #DataGovernance #EthicalAI #DataLiteracy #DigitalHealth #HealthTech #QuantumComputing #VRTraining #GlobalRegulations #HealthcareTechnology #ClevelandClinic #LeadershipSummit #InnovationInHealthcare #DataDrivenHealthcare #HealthcareLeaders #DataEthics #HealthcareQuality #PatientCare #DigitalTransformation #CollaborationIsKey #Analytics

column2:
Gratitude Post:

As I marked the completion of my two-year Cone Health administrative fellowship last Friday, I wanted to take a moment to express my deepest gratitude to everyone who has supported me on this journey.

Over the past two years, I have had the opportunity to work alongside an incredible team, learn from experienced mentors, and take on new responsibilities that have pushed me out of my comfort zone.

But it's not just the skills and knowledge that I've gained that I'm grateful for. It's the people who have made this experience so special. To my colleagues, who have become like a second family to me, thank you for your kindness, guidance, and encouragement. To my mentors, who have taught me so much and believed in me even when I didn't believe in myself, thank you for your wisdom and support. And to ELT, who have given me the freedom to grow and take on new challenges, thank you for your trust and confidence.

This fellowship has been an incredible opportunity for me to develop my skills, build my confidence, and prepare for my next chapter. I am forever grateful for the experience.

To anyone who is considering applying for a fellowship or similar program, I highly recommend it! The growth, learning, and connections you'll make will be invaluable.

#administrativefellowship #gratitude #professionaldevelopment #careergrowth

"Data makes us credible, but stories make us memorable." In this article, Zijing Zhu introduces the 4D framework‚ÄîDefine, Display, Declutter, and Direct‚Äîto enhance data storytelling. "Define" involves crafting a narrative with relatable settings and compelling characters. "Display" focuses on choosing appropriate visualizations. "Declutter" means removing unnecessary details to maintain clarity. Finally, "Direct" involves highlighting key messages and structuring the presentation to capture the audience's attention.

column2:
‚ÄúThe world is a university and everyone in it is a teacher. Make sure when you wake up in the morning, you go to school.‚Äù

That‚Äôs exactly what we do at Brink‚Äôs Inc inc. We are building a culture to be a life long student, we learn everyday, become better everyday and are building the community that is winning together for the common goals.

As the executive sponsor of ASPIRE, Brink‚Äôs Asian American Pacific Islander ERG along with Vinti Gupta as the Chair of ASPIRE, past week we had the great honor to learn from our special guest Anne Chow (She/Her), who as a business leader and a trail blazer is making an impact over three decades at the intersection of people, culture, and technology. Some of her nuggets of wisdom that touched our hearts:

1. #Education is a great equalizer
2. #Be YOUR best everyday
3. Have a deep passion for #Service
4. Every business is a #people business
5. #Leadership is the calling. Leadership is a choice & it transcends.
5. Biggest superpower is #YOU. Be your own authentic self every minute of the day.
6. #Culture is your competitive advantage. It's what in the halls and not what's on the walls.
7. #Lead bigger, lead inclusively. World needs #InclusiveLeadership today!

Thank you Anne Chow for lifting us yet again. I have greatly enjoyed reading your book: The Leader‚Äôs Guide to Unconscious Bias and can not wait to read your new upcoming book LEAD BIGGER.

I am honored and humbled to be recognized with the 2024 Women in Technology Award by the Dallas Business Journal. This award symbolizes more than just personal achievement; it represents the ongoing journey to break the glass ceiling for women in technology.
The awards luncheon was an incredible experience, surrounded by talented and powerful women and allies. My daughter left the room inspired, reminding me how important it is for us to pave the path forward for future generations.
Thank you, Dallas Business Journal, BravoTECH and CDW for your continued support and recognition of the Women in Technology in Dallas community for 11 years. I look forward to seeing this tradition continue in the years to come.
Special thanks to Tracey Bentley,Lauren Mortara (Kerr), Amit Mohan, Joyce King, and Rupam Gupta for being there to cheer and support me. You made my day very special.

I share this award with:
1. My husband - Madhu Reddy, son- Nihal K., and daughter - Shreya Kotragouda, for their unwavering support and sacrifices.
2. My mentors and sponsors, Neal Stephen and Janice Withers, for their continued guidance and encouragement.
3. My amazing Wells Fargo Commercial Lending Technology team and colleagues, who have supported and inspired me along the way.

I am extremely proud to be part of the Wells Fargo family and our company's commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion. Every day, I am inspired and blessed to work with amazing women leaders like Tracy M. Kerrins and Sarah Berwick, who motivate me to strive for excellence.

Lastly, Congratulations to my fellow honorees! Way to go ladies!
Anabella Acosta Dr. Sandra Blanke Veronica Bloodworth Karen Campbell Adrienne Guillory, MBA Cheryl Choy Ambika Dadwal Tera Davis Elyse D. Cynthia Dixon Seema Dwarakish Kelle Fontenot Ayotunde Gibbs Ashley Glover Wei Wei Jeang Kristen Jensen Vanathy Lakshmi Shalini Prasad Alka Siddiqui

Today, Memorial Hermann Health System officially launched Epic with our first wave of users. Thanks to the efforts of over 2,000 team members and our partners at Epic, we're transforming the experience across our medical group, affiliated practices, clinics, pharmacies, and employer solutions with a transformed experience that will help improve the care we deliver to our patients.

This extensive, two-year journey has touched nearly every part of our organization, marking one of the most significant transformations in my career. I'm eager to see the positive changes as we settle into operational efficiency and our patients engage with new digital experiences.

Congratulations to everyone involved, especially Amanda Hammel and Rick Lyman, DSL, MBA for their pivotal roles in guiding this effort. #EPICTransition #DigitalInnovation #PatientExperience

column2:
I re-read Peter Drucker's "The Effective Executive". The lessons are timeless. Here are my top 5 takeaways. 

1. Focus on opportunities not problems.

2. Focus on impact (as opposed to effort). 

3. Manage your time. It's our scarcest resource. 

4. Hire for strengths. Everyone has weaknesses. 

5. Concentrate on a few major areas where your effort will have outsized impact. Prioritize!

What would you add? I think "the work world" generally does #5 the worst. What do you think?

column2:
What a beautiful, yet very sad post which should remind us to live and love life passionately with joy, kindness and gratitude. ‚òÄÔ∏è People like Sarah have been making a positive difference in other people‚Äôs life - do the same, and follow her attitude towards life. 

üíú P.S.: Not my personal loss, but still a very relevant reminder for us all to cherish life and our loved ones.

#gratitude #kindness #authenticity #love
I‚Äôm happy to share that I‚Äôm starting a new position as Director, Program Management supporting Optical at Walmart!

We were lucky to keynote The Millennium Alliance's CHRO Summit in Atlanta, meeting some of the most passionate HR leaders in the country, trying to solve today's most pressing issue.

Half of the world‚Äôs population¬†will experience a mental health disorder¬†in their lifetime‚Äîand yet, the vast majority of those impacted¬†won‚Äôt receive any treatment at all.

What's been most surprising to me is that the responsibility to solve this issue has fallen not on therapists or on the government, but instead, on HR leaders, who have been pressured to understand how employee mental health needs are growing so quickly, while mental health benefit utilization remains shockingly low. 

I'm proud of all the work we've done at Zeera to build a new care model that adequately supports mental health needs, without requiring folks to sit on a waitlist, with tremendous engagement rates. There is still so much work to do to solve the accelerating rate of mental illness; excited to continue working at it alongside the HR leaders on the frontlines.

Today, we announced a significant expansion of our HIV screening services since debuting them at two pharmacies in Virginia late last year. We‚Äôre adding 10 additional HIV screening locations across Virginia and eight in Colorado, bringing our total number of HIV point-of-care screening locations to 20. According to the CDC, 13 percent of people in Virginia with HIV, and 13 percent of people in Colorado with HIV, are unaware of their status. It‚Äôs our hope that this expansion will increase access, reduce stigma and connect people to care in ways they haven‚Äôt been before. Each screening location features highly trained pharmacists who are uniquely positioned to support those who need it. We look forward to this continued journey of improving health outcomes for all.

It is truly an honor to be named one of Modern Healthcare's 50 Most Influential Clinical Executives. I‚Äôm grateful to all the people who have supported me throughout my career ‚Äì from my mentors, health care teams, leaders and my patients who have put their trust in me. 

Every day, I‚Äôm inspired by the health care professionals I work with and have the utmost respect for. They all share my commitment to clinical integrity and to transforming health care ‚Äì making sure it‚Äôs accessible and affordable. 

I want to congratulate all the clinicians who are on this year‚Äôs list. I‚Äôm in very good company! I also want to give a special congrats to my colleague Dr. Marisa Rogers, Chief Medical Officer of Oak Street Health, for being recognized. Thank you, Dr. Rogers, for all that you do to ensure the people we serve receive quality care.

Being a father is without a doubt one of the greatest joys‚Äîand greatest responsibilities‚Äîof my life. Watching my daughter graduate with her master's in social work from University of Washington last weekend was a milestone reminder of that! I‚Äôm so incredibly proud of her and so grateful to have a front-row seat as her dad to all she‚Äôs accomplished and all that‚Äôs still to come. My own dad set a wonderful example, modeling a strong work ethic and a desire to always do right by people and treat them with respect. Thinking of him and all the fathers out there today who try every day to get it right, with thanks for the guidance and love that they offer their families‚Äîhappy Father‚Äôs Day to you all!

This weekend our home of Northwest Arkansas was hit with some strong storms. Now, our number one priority is supporting our associates and community. I'm so thankful for all our associates who have stepped up to help, like Al, Jen, Rickey, Joe, and everyone else pitching in to serve hot meals to our friends and neighbors today. I also appreciate Hollie and the team from the Neighborhood Market 3654 in Rogers for their hard work, and our partnership with Tyson Foods. Thank you, all!

üó£Vulnerable post üôÉ

I was having a blah kinda week. You know one of those weeks where you feel like you're running in a hamster wheelü•¥. Well my phenomenal staff at our Collins-Westside location decided to love on me today to show their appreciation during a pivotal time for us all, and ya'll they made me cry. 

A good cry though, one of gratitude. üíó
As a leader you don't always get it right, but every great leader surrounds themselves with great people, leads with good intentions, cultivates genuine relationships, and stays humble enough to pivot for the greater good. 

This Collins-Westside team, Ebony N. S. and I opened the 1st Walmart Health in the State of Florida, and Suzette Quaintance took the reigns and carried on our reputation of being the "A" Team, and boy do I love this team. This was just a handfull of them today, as we are winding down our operations across the enterprise. 

As we approach our final month of delivering care to our communities, what I will miss the most at Walmart Health, are the people. These people believed in our mission, they lived it, they executed it, and they did an amazing job! 

If I could sum up my Walmart Health experience in one word, it would simply be "PROUD". 

PROUD of our people
PROUD of our work
PROUD of our imprint
PROUD of our impact
PROUD of the seeds we have planted, that we hope to see grow. 

PROUD, is honestly an understatement, but... it will do for now. 


Grateful, Thankful, and Blessed. üíó

Last week I took most of my Walmart Health leaders out for a last thank you lunch- we missed you Suzette and Lauren!

I‚Äôm so proud my team and their dedication to accessible, compassionate healthcare. I look forward to seeing them shine in their next chapter!

Happy Father's Day from all of us at EME! Today, we celebrate the incredible dads who bring love, strength, and joy to our lives every day. Thank you for all that you do! üíô

#HappyFathersDay #EMECompany
