I have been deeply moved by the outpouring of support the organization, my team, and I have received over the past month. I‚Äôm overwhelmed by all the heartfelt messages, phone calls, and kindness from friends and colleagues, as well as the lamenting by patients at the loss of the Walmart Health Care Access Point. I joked with Morgan that I think I‚Äôve heard from everyone I‚Äôve ever met at this point.

Since we announced the closure of Walmart Health, I‚Äôve sat down many times to write my thoughts.

Yesterday, some of my team spent time together in person for likely the last time. Through all the noise, the core message is clear. This is how I will remember Walmart Health: the patients we served, the impact we had in our communities, the vision of what nationally scalable, accessible, and high-quality healthcare could look like, the incredible talent brought to bear, and the lasting friendships.

Joseph Addison wrote, ‚ÄúWe cannot insure success, but we can deserve it.‚Äù I‚Äôm looking forward to seeing the great things everyone will go on to do and the problems this team will solve.

These are my favorite awards, because they're won by our employees and their feedback! I'm so grateful @The Tennessean recognized our incredible team that makes @EvidenceCare a top workplace. 

Thank you Tennessean for your efforts to highlight great teams.

Excited to talk mental health with Zeera's Chief Clinical Officer, Rachel Hoffman, PhD, focused on a topic that is too-often neglected: the mental health of deskless workers. From truck drivers and manufacturing employees, to store associates and hospitality workers, deskless workers make up 80% of our global workforce and face high rates of mental illness, yet have remarkably poor access to care.

üåÄ Research shows that mistreatment by customers ‚Äî something that¬†62% of restaurant employees¬†experienced in 2021 alone ‚Äî drives burn out and leads to mental illness.
üåÄ BIPOC make up 40% of retail workers ‚Äî but our country‚Äôs therapist population can only support 1.7% of people of color in America.

And yet, the availability of mental health benefits is far rarer for deskless workers‚Äîand even when mental health benefits are available to deskless workers, they completely miss the mark, failing to support the unique needs, schedules and culture of deskless employees.

Join us this June to talk through how we can solve the problem together ‚ú® Register here: https://lnkd.in/gAZtcEeW

Health system leaders face unprecedented challenges in modern medicine, and the call to address them is urgent. The shift to #valuebasedcare is crucial for health systems in enhancing patient outcomes and ensuring financial sustainability. Continued improvement in managing the cost of care will produce significant growth in the long-term.
 
Now is the time for health systems to invest in VBC infrastructure and innovative technologies. And there is no need to go it alone!
 
Access our new blog on the strategic imperative of value-based care for health systems and prepare to thrive. https://bit.ly/3xruh4x

#populationhealth #healthcarestrategy
I‚Äôm happy to share that I‚Äôm starting a new position as Senior Vice President, Clinical Strategy at Clinical Care Medical Centers!

Well today was my last day at Ochsner Health Plan.  After being in the workforce (and paying income taxes) since I was 16 years old - back in 1969 - this old pharmacist is retiring. 

My goal has always been to make a real difference in at least one person's life each and every day.


To dream the impossible dream
 To fight the unbeatable foe
 To bear with unbearable sorrow
 To run where the brave dare not go
 
 To right the unrightable wrong
 To try when your arms are too weary
 To reach the unreachable star
 
 This is my quest, to follow that star
 No matter how hopeless, no matter how far
 To be willing to march into Hell for a Heavenly cause.
 
And I know if I'll only be true to this glorious quest
That my heart will lie peaceful and calm when I'm laid to my rest
 
 And the world will be better for this
 That one man, scorned and covered with scars
 Still strove with his last ounce of courage
 To reach the unreachable star

Thank you and God Bless!
Alan

I‚Äôm thrilled to share that at Shepherd Center, we‚Äôve been working alongside a team of esteemed experts across the venture capital, technology, and science industries to launch @SCI Ventures, the first venture philanthropy fund focused on catalyzing the development of innovative therapies for people living with paralysis.
 
As a neurorehabilitation hospital that prides itself on providing world-class clinical care, research, and family support for people experiencing the most complex conditions, including spinal cord injury, partnership in launching #SCIVentures marks a natural milestone in our journey and in our dedication to advancing breakthroughs for those affected by spinal cord injury.
 
Since spinal cord injury is a strategic starting point for many other complex conditions ‚Äì
including stroke and neurodegenerative disorders ‚Äì we‚Äôre embracing an enormous opportunity through SCI Ventures to create an entirely new chapter in the medical and scientific fields.
 
Read more about the launch. https://lnkd.in/gq_DhBfs

I reached the finish line! I‚Äôm a proud Kellogg MBA!

This past weekend, I officially achieved my goal of pursuing an MBA. Over the past two years, I've expanded my toolkit with new frameworks, perspectives, experiences, friendships, and significant personal and professional growth. This experience exceeded all the expectations I had imagined.

I couldn't have made this possible without the unwavering support of my husband, Dave Russ, MBA, CPA, and my children, Hannah and Michael. I also want to thank my incredible study group, the Lakeshore Legends: Dylan Buckley, Ritu Thomas, Tom Riley, Manoj Arigela, Thomas Zukowski, MD, MBA, and Ram Ananthakrishnan. A big thanks to my family, friends, and the amazing Northwestern University - Kellogg School of Management faculty and staff.

Here's to making a lasting positive impact in the healthcare ecosystem, driven by the unique perspective¬†of a physical therapist with an MBA!

#KelloggLeader #EMBA #LowEgoHighImpact #BeIntentional #BeThoughtful #KSM24 #LifeExperience #KelloggHealthcare

column2:
Big news! Today is the launch of SCI Ventures, the first venture philanthropy fund focused on accelerating the development of innovative therapies for people living with paralysis ‚Äì and Shepherd Center is part of it!

As a co-founder of SCI Ventures, we‚Äôre on a mission to spark innovation and bridge the gap between lab research and making discoveries available to help restore functions for those with spinal cord injury and ultimately cure paralysis.

At Shepherd Center, we‚Äôre honored to come together with Wings for Life - Spinal Cord Research Foundation, Spinal Research, Christopher & Dana Reeve Foundation, and Promobilia Foundation to support this single, first-of-its-kind, and truly game-changing investment vehicle. Through our combined network and knowledge, we plan to attract more capital to the SCI space by lowering the risk for additional investors from across the VC and healthcare industries. 

Through our combined network and knowledge, we hope to attract more capital, investment, and awareness to develop therapies that will help people begin again after spinal cord injury.

Read more about the launch: https://bit.ly/3VxEsxE

I‚Äôm thrilled to share that at Shepherd Center, we‚Äôve been working alongside a team of esteemed experts across the venture capital, technology, and science industries to launch @SCI Ventures, the first venture philanthropy fund focused on catalyzing the development of innovative therapies for people living with paralysis.
 
As a neurorehabilitation hospital that prides itself on providing world-class clinical care, research, and family support for people experiencing the most complex conditions, including spinal cord injury, partnership in launching #SCIVentures marks a natural milestone in our journey and in our dedication to advancing breakthroughs for those affected by spinal cord injury.
 
Since spinal cord injury is a strategic starting point for many other complex conditions ‚Äì
including stroke and neurodegenerative disorders ‚Äì we‚Äôre embracing an enormous opportunity through SCI Ventures to create an entirely new chapter in the medical and scientific fields.
 
Read more about the launch. https://lnkd.in/gq_DhBfs

column2:
I reached the finish line! I‚Äôm a proud Kellogg MBA!

This past weekend, I officially achieved my goal of pursuing an MBA. Over the past two years, I've expanded my toolkit with new frameworks, perspectives, experiences, friendships, and significant personal and professional growth. This experience exceeded all the expectations I had imagined.

I couldn't have made this possible without the unwavering support of my husband, Dave Russ, MBA, CPA, and my children, Hannah and Michael. I also want to thank my incredible study group, the Lakeshore Legends: Dylan Buckley, Ritu Thomas, Tom Riley, Manoj Arigela, Thomas Zukowski, MD, MBA, and Ram Ananthakrishnan. A big thanks to my family, friends, and the amazing Northwestern University - Kellogg School of Management faculty and staff.

Here's to making a lasting positive impact in the healthcare ecosystem, driven by the unique perspective¬†of a physical therapist with an MBA!

#KelloggLeader #EMBA #LowEgoHighImpact #BeIntentional #BeThoughtful #KSM24 #LifeExperience #KelloggHealthcare

Our Melville, N.Y., testing laboratory has added U.S. FDA registration to test over-the-counter (#OTC) drug products! 

Capabilities now also include #cosmetic and #supplement testing.

Additional services will initially focus on microbiology, with analytical chemistry to be added in the coming months:

> Microbiology (USP <51>, <61>, <62>); pathogens
> Preservative Efficacy Testing (PET)
> ISO 17025-accredited
> cGMP/cGLP-compliant

Our team, including Elaha Karimi, Richard Boehler, and Robert Scott, are now processing samples.

Message Michael Silvia if you need testing.

It was a pleasure to speak at the #TMForum‚Äôs #DTW24-Ignite conference about how #AI is transforming our industry.
 
I covered four key points.
 
First ‚Äì¬†Common cases for AI. These include improving the customer experience, better network planning and response to issues, and supporting employees by, for example, generating code.
 
Second ‚Äì¬†Prepare for AI. Create a data strategy and an investment case. Start with pilot projects and ensure seamless integration with existing systems and processes. And most importantly, implement ethical guidelines and monitor AI performance and outcomes.
 
Third ‚Äì¬†Partnerships. Work with hyperscalers to gain access to the latest AI tech, improve cost efficiency, focus on core business functions, and accelerate innovation, all while ensuring robust security and compliance.
 
Fourth ‚Äì¬†Balance the risk of being too early vs too late.¬†Thoroughly evaluate pilot programs, collaborate, and share experiences with partners.
 
Ultimately AI must meet our purpose, which is to connect people securely, safely and with their privacy as a priority.
 
https://www.tmforum.org/

Our team, including Nick Buschur, Ian F., Sue Ann Seitz, Stephanie Wilkins, Jake Parr, Luis Navarro, Krista Keller, Randal Garrett, Alex Brandt, Wayne Muraoka, and Mandi Farrens will be at #IAFP next month in Long Beach, California!

We have announced Vodafone Group‚Äôs preliminary results for the 2024 financial year:

- Group organic service revenue increased by +6.3%, and we are now delivering growth in all of our markets across Europe and Africa.
- Vodafone Germany, our largest business, returned to growth
- We saw continued acceleration in B2B revenue throughout the year, with Vodafone Business FY24 service revenue +5.0%.
- Adjusted EBITDAaL increased by 2.2% like-for-like.
- Strategic successes over the year included:
‚ñ∂Ô∏è Customers: ‚Ç¨140m invested in improving customer experience. Now lead, or co-lead, net promoter scores in 5 out of 9 European markets. 
‚ñ∂Ô∏è Simplicity: New organisational structure and management team in place. 
‚ñ∂Ô∏è Growth: Re-shaped Vodafone‚Äôs European footprint with sales agreed of businesses in Spain and Italy, and a merger between Vodafone UK and Three UK to increase competition and deliver better 5G networks for UK customers. 

Our CEO, Margherita Della Valle said: ‚ÄúA year ago, I set out my plans to transform Vodafone, including the need to right-size Europe for growth. Since then, we have announced a series of transactions and we are now delivering growth in all of our markets across Europe and Africa. Much more still needs to be done in the year ahead. We will step-up investment in our customer experience, improve our underlying performance in Germany and accelerate our momentum in Business, whilst also continuing to simplify our operations throughout the group. We are fundamentally transforming Vodafone for growth.‚Äù

You can read the full results news release here: https://lnkd.in/dw_n3P9H

It is an honor to have been elected Spencer Stuart's next Managing Partner. I'm looking forward to starting in late July and am humbled to serve in this capacity. Certified Group is pleased to announce David L. Morgan II as Chief Executive Officer. Mr. Morgan succeeds Amanda Bosse, who remains with the Company as an Advisor. 

Certified Group companies (Certified Laboratories, Inc., EAS Consulting Group, LLC, Food Safety Net Services, and Labstat International Inc.) provide mission-critical and time-sensitive testing and regulatory consulting services to the food & beverage, dietary supplement & NHP, cosmetic, OTC, personal care, tobacco/nicotine, cannabis, hemp, and other regulated end markets.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs an exciting time to join the company, and I strongly believe in the significant growth opportunities ahead. I look forward to continuing the company‚Äôs mission to consistently provide quality lab testing services and a best-in-class platform, and I believe the company is well positioned to grow,‚Äù said Morgan.

In addition to Mr. Morgan‚Äôs appointment, Deborah Kerr will join Certified Group as Executive Chair. 

Ms. Kerr is a Managing Director and Co-Head of Value Creation at Warburg Pincus, a majority investor in Certified Group. 

‚ÄúAfter working closely with Certified over the past 5 years, I strongly believe in the unique market position the company has in providing differentiated lab testing services. I look forward to working closely with David; his experience leading healthcare and diagnostics companies will bring a strong, experienced perspective to the strategic direction of the company,‚Äù said Kerr.

Read the full press release here: https://hubs.ly/Q02ygZsM0

column2:
I'm excited to announce I've joined Sentara Health as the Executive Vice President and President of Acute Care and Post-Acute Services. This is an incredible opportunity to make a real impact on the health of our communities.

What drew me to Sentara Health is its significant system-wide growth. With a health plan and care delivery services in multiple states and plans to expand, more people can access a variety of health services, from hospitals to outpatient centers. This expansion brings top-notch care closer to home.

The One Sentara model is a game-changer for community health; by integrating health plans with care delivery, it ensures preventive services are covered and post-acute services are seamlessly included, aligning with my vision for comprehensive, community-focused care.

I'm excited to work alongside the amazing team at Sentara to enhance our services and improve patient outcomes. Together, we'll make a difference and promote a healthier future for everyone.

Thank you for your support and encouragement as I embark on this new journey.
column11: System EVP and CEO Care Delivery System Operations Henry Ford Health

The CEO and Power of U‚Ä¶!

These were the key themes of Dominion Energy‚Äôs Women‚Äôs Conference.¬†It was an inspiring celebration of the power of community to support one another in our lives and careers. It featured phenomenal speakers such as Hannah Craft Sower and Angela D. Reddix, Ph.D.

I was fortunate to be a part of this awesome event and have the opportunity to speak to ideas that are deeply important to me: the power of your words and the value of your voice.

The 2024 Dominion Energy Women‚Äôs Conference is complete and what a great time was had by all! We have many rock stars on our Dominion Energy team.  Thank you to Robert Blue Diane Leopold Carlos M. Brown for being part of the program and for enabling and sponsoring a culture of inclusion. Dominion Energy celebrates women in many ways - we belong here - our girl power is infectious - this was a meaningful and powerful way to show that commitment! Dominion Energy

Wednesday marked a monumental splash as we installed the first of 176 monopile foundations as part of our Coastal Virginia Offshore Wind project. These steel, vertical cylinders measure over 272 feet long and tip the scales at nearly 1,500 tons each! 

Anchored into the sea floor 29 miles off the Virginia Beach coast, this foundation is set to support a tower and turbine nearly as tall as the Statue of Liberty and Washington Monument combined. 

Now that‚Äôs a strong foundation for a cleaner energy future! 

Read more: https://lnkd.in/erXCEpzy

Great things happen when you put together 30,000 books, 3,000 kindergartners, a book fair and a summer reading program‚Ä¶

Our volunteers from Cope and Wateree power stations in South Carolina helped kindergartners in Colleton and Bamberg counties select 10 grade-level reading books to take home. The Original Six Foundation, a nonprofit that focuses on literacy in rural and underserved areas of the state, received a grant from Dominion Energy to help fund its My First Library program and these end-of-the-year book fairs.

Please take a couple of minutes to listen and share this message about forgiveness, grace, and gratitude.

Congratulations #classof2024
Longwood University

When I moved back to my hometown in 2016, I found an RVA that had transformed and grown in so many positive ways. 

Upon my return, one of the first events I attended was a talk by Sports Backers' Executive Director, Jon Lugbill, about the organization‚Äôs progress and impact on the community‚Äîand I was blown away. 

Jon also shared his vision for Sportsbackers. 

He spoke eloquently about the James River ‚Äì and what an asset it is for our community. 

While the accessible, clean river is a key part of the canvas that makes RVA so livable, and in the words of Jon, our ‚Äúawesome active, outdoor river town,‚Äù the people of Sportsbackers help paint it to life. 

Every year, Dominion Energy RiverRock fills the James River and surrounding canal area with leaping dogs, kayaks, concerts, and more than 100,000 smiling faces. 

Each spring, SportsBackers transforms Monument Ave, filling it with runners and its median with meditators, live bands, cheering crowds, and so much more‚Äîfor what I believe is the country‚Äôs fourth-largest 10K. 

They partner with companies like Markel for the #CorporateRun. 
And they fill the holiday season with the CarMax TackyLight Run and whimsy. And more: https://lnkd.in/gXVjXbgS

This spring, it was a pleasure to partner with Megan Schultz and Will Dixon from Sportsbackers‚Äîboth dedicated RVA ‚Äúpainters‚Äù‚Äîto make the inaugural Markel Group Reunion Walk & Run happen. 

Megan and Will are quintessential ‚Äúyes, and‚Ä¶‚Äù people with incredible energy and positivity. 

Thank you, Megan, Will, and Sportsbackers, for your amazing contributions to our city.

column2: I‚Äôm happy to share that I‚Äôm starting a new position as Department Manager of the Manhattan Electric Control Center at Con Edison!
What an amazing experience!  It‚Äôs fantastic to see how NYC is turning our garbage into useful energy and reducing GHGs in the process. Hope there‚Äôs more to come!

Twenty- three years ago, I walked into a room, joined a cohort, and expected a few years would pass before I moved on to something else. Along the way, I have had the opportunity to interact with thousands of our customers, start and complete transformative projects and programs, cheered on colleagues as they achieved their version of success, learned from brilliant leaders, and most importantly, made friendships that have made all the difference in my life. There have been epic highs and devastating losses, but I wouldn't trade a moment of it. 

Thanks to all of my colleagues for making it such a wonderful place to work.

Some great sessions at the Northeast Energy Efficiency Partnerships (NEEP) conference this week in Weehawken, NJ sponsored by Con Edison. Lots of exciting synergies in policy, federal, state, and utility funding for clean energy and equitable decarbonization. Now, the work begins!  Wish I could have caught every session. Lots of good discussions on streamlining access to incentives and initiatives to improve and standardize rebate and energy efficiency project data.

I‚Äôm happy to share that I‚Äôm starting a new position as Senior Manager, Energy Efficiency and Beneficial Electrification at Baltimore Gas and Electric!

I'm thrilled to be joining the BGE Clean Energy Solutions team while so very thankful for my time at Pepco Holdings.

Great teams working on great things!

Con Edison AKF Group Adam Shelly Charlie Marino Brittni Provencher, PMP
I‚Äôm happy to share that I‚Äôm starting a new position as Principal Energy Consultant at Dandelion Energy!

I‚Äôm excited to share that today I am transitioning to the role of senior advisor to the retirement business at BlackRock. It is a time for reflection as well as a step toward the future.

My journey with BlackRock actually started well before I joined the firm.¬†As BlackRock‚Äôs investment banker at Merrill Lynch, I helped BlackRock launch some of its early closed end funds. When I decided to join BlackRock officially in 2000 as the head of the retail team, I could only imagine what an amazing and fulfilling career journey I would have - helping to build one of the best investment management firms in the world. 
 
For the last nine years, I have had the privilege of leading BlackRock‚Äôs US retirement business. I am so grateful to our clients, who helped me understand what it means for their employees to retire with dignity. I have been humbled by the work of so many in the industry to make the retirement system work for everyone. I have been inspired by my colleagues‚Äô passion to make secure retirements within the reach of every worker. 
 
Now, it‚Äôs my turn. And, if I‚Äôm honest, it‚Äôs a little weird. I don‚Äôt have plans to slow down any time soon. Frankly, the word ‚Äúretirement‚Äù just doesn‚Äôt fit how I feel. I see it more as my ‚Äúnext chapter‚Äù ‚Äì and I really like the Spanish word for it: jubilacion. Because that is how I feel. Joyful. I feel full of energy that I get to continue to work on the issues that matter to me most. I also feel incredibly grateful to everyone who has helped me and inspired me on my journey. I‚Äôm excited to see what this next stage brings.

Do you also suffer from ONE thing that can hinder your career progression and may make your day to day work a struggle?



These statements were taken randomly from some of my clients‚Äô worksheets, do you recognise yourself in any of them?


ü•∫ Usually, I doubt myself and find out later that I was right at first.


üòü I do care very heavily about what people think about me.


ü§® I want people to know that ‚Äúhe‚Äôs good‚Äù at what he does. I want that reputation.


üòí I worry about the perception from colleagues


üò∞ My procrastination on the task that scares me the most: prepping well for the evaluation session. I am to some extent afraid of being successful, so I don‚Äôt even try.



So, what is that ONE thing?



These days it is conveniently referred to as ‚Äúthe impostor syndrome‚Äù however, it is a combination of several intertwined thought patterns and behaviours that may be difficult to dissect and understand. They could include:

-Depending excessively on external validation

-Self doubt

-Lack of confidence

-Feeling not good enough (or a fraud)

-Fear of failure

-Fear of success

And more‚Ä¶

If you have experienced similar thoughts, moods, emotions that have impacted your performance, your clarity and drive and as a result you are ‚Äúselling yourself short‚Äù or are not being as bold as you‚Äôd like, know that:

‚ú≥Ô∏è Even the most successful, powerful people have these experiences

‚ú≥Ô∏è Consistent work on yourself will pay off ‚Äì understanding your limiting beliefs is a first step!

‚ú≥Ô∏è You can ‚Äúfeel the fear and do it anyway!‚Äù but that‚Äôs so much easier if someone has your back

‚ú≥Ô∏è What other people think of you ‚Äì is none of your business!

‚ú≥Ô∏è What you think of yourself is entirely your business!

‚ú≥Ô∏è Focus on YOU and not on others. Do what you can, with what you‚Äôve got ‚Äì NOW

‚ú≥Ô∏è Love your life and your life will love you back!

And if this is not enough, do talk to me ‚Äì I‚Äôm very high on compassion (according to Jordan Peterson - more than 93 people in a room of 100) and I can also teach you some saboteur-slaying techniques! ü§£ üòú

üò≤ $100M as an NBA player...why not!? Luka Doncic of the Dallas Mavericks might out-earn Jordan and LeBron combined! 

....Meanwhile, Caitlin Clark who has dominated the news is earning $76,500 in her rookie year. üò° ....

What should you know?

üí∏ CNBC reported that 60% of NBA players go broke within 5 years of departing the league

üí∏ The average male retirement age is between 28-34 
üí∏ The average WNBA player lasts about 5 years in the league, also retiring in their early 30s

Ouch.

üèÄ Being an all star athlete requires outrageous physical, spiritual, and mental hard work and discipline. Then you arrive... and?

The discipline related to money is different. Preservation requires an emotional anchor to the future. ‚öì 

Athletes, particularly, struggle to find opportunities to make the same kind of money later in life. They live a dream for a few years and at retirement, they wake up. üòï 

‚òÅ Get out of the present by imagining the future. 
- Who is there?
- Where are you?
- What are you doing?
- Where are you living?
- What activities are you enjoying?
- How often do you travel? to where?
- What car are you driving?
- What are your ongoing sources of income?
- Are you working?
- Have you invested in assets that accumulate value over time?
- Are you aligning your money with your values? How?
- What makes you feel alive?
- What is keeping you active, fulfilled, finding purpose and meaning?
- Who do you share your money with? How?

Think about this NOW dear Luka. The odds are not in your favor.

If you need some help working through your relationship with the future. Give us a try at knomee.com! We're here to help!

Ready, Set, AI!

Approximately eighteen months after OpenAI launched ChatGPT, we are witnessing the rapid ascension of artificial intelligence across various sectors. The term ‚ÄúAI‚Äù has become a ubiquitous buzzword in technology, frequently appearing in pitch decks, management meetings, and boardrooms globally. Recent reports indicating that OpenAI is generating approximately $3.4 billion in annual revenue underscore the profound impact and economic potential of this technology.

At Aliya Capital Partners, we are optimistic about the future of AI, though we remain judicious in our investment selections. We believe AI holds transformative potential, heralding a paradigm shift in multiple facets of life and business. The global AI market is projected to grow from $94 billion in 2021 to $998 billion by 2028, reflecting a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of over 40%. Major industries, including healthcare, finance, and logistics, are increasingly integrating AI to enhance efficiency and innovation. We are already seeing how AI-driven diagnostics in healthcare are improving patient outcomes, while algorithmic trading in finance is optimizing investment strategies.

Moreover, AI advancements are contributing to significant cost savings and productivity gains. A McKinsey report suggests that AI could deliver up to $13 trillion in additional global economic activity by 2030, boosting global GDP by about 1.2% annually.

Dear Friends and Colleagues,

I would like to share with you that on May 20, 2024, our beloved dad, Shan K. Thever, passed away.

Our dad was a vibrant personality, energetic professional and dedicated husband, father and grandfather. He was an inspiration in so many ways and to so many people. 

He came to this country with only a few hundred dollars in his pocket. Through his determination, hard work and tenacity, he successfully completed his undergraduate education at UCLA and received his JD from UCLA School of Law. 

Our dad went on to establish and lead a successful law practice for decades. He was a trailblazer and a pioneer both in and out of the courtroom. He was courageous, took risks and overcame numerous obstacles, and was a preeminent attorney, successfully arguing cases in front of the California Supreme Court. He served as the Director of the Small Law Firm Center at the New York City Bar Association and for the past five years he served as the Deputy County Council for Los Angeles County as a member of the Ethics, Transparency and Legislative Affairs team.

Our dad was a colleague, friend and confidant of Governors, County Supervisors, Council Members and so many others. In addition to numerous awards and appointments, he received the inaugural Trailblazer Award from the South Asian Bar Association and was recognized by the U.S. House of Representatives, receiving a U.S. Congressional Commendation for being an inspiring leader in the South Asian community and a true advocate for political change among the Asian population.

He was an inspiration not only for the professional success he achieved, but also for the way he lived his life. He believed in living a productive and meaningful life, in helping others, in lifting his community and in creating greater opportunity for his children than he had himself. He instilled in us a deep responsibility to, in turn, create greater opportunity for our children and generations to come. He also instilled in us the importance of public service and of being contributing members of society and having a meaningful impact on the world.

In his personal time he loved to be with his family celebrating holidays, cooking together, and discussing politics and current events over a bottle of Cabernet. 

He loved his grandchildren more than anything and was so very proud to see the young people they are and the success they continue to achieve. He was happy to see the wealth of opportunity in front of them. 

While he may not be here in physical form, our dad is always with us. He lived a successful, productive and impactful life, and this world is a better place because of him.

We ask that if you have any special anecdotes, stories or memories about our dad to please share with us via private message.

I‚Äôm retiring and downsizing to an RV called Priscilla. It's a bit scary. A lot of your self-worth gets locked up in the job over time. I get bored easily. And is there enough $$? But mostly, I‚Äôm VERY excited. Gotta take some risk to live! We‚Äôre planning to take Priscilla on two big loops. This year up to Newfoundland and down to the Yucatan; next year up to Alaska and back down to Mexico‚Äôs Pacific coast. Then we‚Äôll sell her, move to France and explore from there. I'm glad we're RVing now that we're still relatively young. Priscilla may look pretty sleek, but she‚Äôs really a wooden box on wheels stuffed with electronics. There‚Äôs lots to know if you don‚Äôt want to blow up the poop tank!¬†And you need to do lots of planning ... or find yourself packed like sardines at a campsite just off the highway. Let‚Äôs see how it goes. If it‚Äôs a bust, my next post will be something like: "Help! Anybody need a non-AI writer/editor or (if I‚Äôm really desperate) an operations guy?"

2022 LinkedIn Selling Strategies don't work anymore...

We've all been there ‚Äì you accept a LinkedIn connection request, and BAM! Immediate sales pitch. This needs to end. Imagine meeting someone on the street, them saying "nice to meet you," and then instantly asking you for money or some crazy trade. You would think they are nuts.

Here's a better approach (and there are about 1000 better than the one above): leverage the accepted connection to gain insights and develop a genuine relationship. Learn what's important to them. Comment on their posts, share insights they may find valuable, and build trust and credibility through those actions.

When the time is right, send a message that aligns with what you've learned. Provide a thoughtful, Doug Landis-patented hypothesis that demonstrates you understand their business (and needs). No sales pitch is necessary in that message either!

Don't want to be treated like a spam account? Then stop acting like one.

And if you put the sales pitch in the connection request, that's an automatic decline for me.

If you lead a gtm team, you're probably working on your plan for the second half of the year. Here's how to make that planning process 10x better:

(1) Go talk to 10 customers. Ask them what they were most curious about +  most worried about while they were thinking about buying your thing. Ask them what they were doing before you showed up. Ask them about the moment they knew they needed something better. Ask them when they knew you were the right choice for them. Take notes. Record the convos if you can. Buy them coffee or lunch or donate to a charity on their behalf as a thank you. Follow up with your team re: any lingering support or product issues they bring up. Close the loop. 

(2) Go talk to every single one of your sales reps. Ask them where the dead spots are in your sales pitch and product demo, what the most helpful pieces of marketing content are, and what else is on their wish-list. Ask them what's getting in their way. Ask them what they need to win one more 50/50 deal this year. Listen. 

I promise you after these conversations (which should take you about two weeks to finish), you will have more ideas than you know what to do with. It‚Äôll be shockingly easy to build yourself a plan for the next 6 months, sourced directly from your two most important customers: 

The people who buy your stuff, and the people who sell it. 

So get out of the spreadsheet, and get into the field. 

The answer is out there.

A sales leader buddy was chased down by an SDR for disco and demo. He said, ‚Äúsure, why not.‚Äù Then things went sideways. 

AE who took the call was ‚Äúworking while traveling‚Äù, working off laptop with no secondary monitor, no headset (not even crappy AirPods), and wearing a tank top on the call. 

Just peak amateur hour. Awful demo. Mailing it in. 

Your staff need very, very clear guardrails. 

Get them in the office, equip them, train them, inspect that they‚Äôre using their equipment and training.

And of course he texted me immediately because he knew this would drive me up a wall.
Many people are managing things that don't matter...  How to avoid this:

Most B2B companies are still running their content strategy like it's 2012. Pushing whitepapers and webinars to drive MQLs is outdated, ineffective, and way too expensive. Here's why:

Metadata published a report analyzing $37M ad spend on lead gen campaigns.

The result: only 0.2%(!) of MQLs converted to closed-won deals. 

That means you need 500 leads to acquire a new customer‚Äîwhich is painfully inefficient given the average cost per lead of $123.

The driving force behind this is the significant shift in buyer behavior:

1. Buyers now prefer to educate themselves at their own pace, diving deep into content to find solutions to their challenges (without giving up their email address or phone number in a lead form).

2. The buying journey has become more dynamic and unpredictable, with dark social channels playing a crucial role in how buyers gather information.

3. Buying committees have nearly tripled in size over the past decade, leading to longer sales cycles and a greater need for multiple touchpoints.

_____

Your content strategy needs to reflect these changes. Here's how:

‚úÖ Conduct interviews with your 10 best customers and analyze 20 recent sales call recordings to identify pain points and objections.

‚úÖ Develop content pillars and topics that revolve around these pain points and objections.

‚úÖ Identify 3-5 internal subject matter experts (SMEs) who are comfortable on camera and willing to build their LinkedIn presence. Preferably include 1-2 people from the executive team.

‚úÖ Conduct bi-weekly interviews with each SME. Turn each interview recording into 1 long-form article, 4+ video clips and 10+ LinkedIn posts.

‚úÖ Publish this content on the personal LinkedIn profiles of your SMEs (3-5x per week). Publish the article and video clips on the website, repurpose the interview recording for YouTube and create a weekly newsletter with the best insights from the interviews.

‚úÖ After 2 months, start running LinkedIn Thought Leader Ads* to promote the top-performing LinkedIn posts to your target accounts.

*Paid social should mainly be used for content distribution, not lead generation. Would you rather pay $150 for 100 decision makers to read your case study, or $150 for just one person to maybe read your whitepaper?

‚úÖ Roll out an employee advocacy program to turn the rest of your employees into an organic marketing channel.

_____

Buyer behavior evolves‚Äîso should your content strategy.

Fewer than 25% of sales organizations have a forecast accuracy of 75% or greater according to Korn Ferry.

As an example, Salesforce missed its revenue forecast for the first time in 20 years two weeks ago, causing a 20% drop in stock ($40+ billion in market cap - since then recovered to -12.77%).

The ripple effects can be huge:
-  Stressful board meetings
-  Drop in equity value
-  Re-forecast
-  Sales capacity wrong
-  Re-structuring

No question - accurate forecasting is hard.

As a SaaS scale-up, you don't need to forecast +/-2% before the quarter starts like Salesforce.

Actually, you shouldn't - way too much time would be lost trying to perfect the forecast process.

BUT, you should aim get to > 90% by week 4.

Forecasting isn't about the final number - it's a process that should help you beat the outcome in a predictable way.

Here are 3 simply tips to improve your forecasting process:

1.  Run a forecast process
-  Most SaaS companies run a weekly rhythm
-  Clean pipeline data is paramount
-  1-1s, pipeline reviews, and forecasting meetings
-  Track weekly changes

2.  Forecast new logo + expansions + renewals separately
-  Forecast your pipeline for new logo, expansions and renewals
-  Adjust stages, and forecast categories to mirror you new logo, expansion, and -  renewal process

3.  Combine forecasts
-  Weighted, bottom-up, Ops or/and AI prediction to have different input factors
-  Tweak the weighted and ops model to increase accuracy
-  Track forecast accuracy of bottom up forecast

üëá Get the cheat sheet to improve your forecast accuracy üëá

Comment "forecast" to get your high-resolution copy.

#sales #forecasting #revops

This year, we celebrate a monumental milestone‚ÄîBel Fuse Inc.'s 75th anniversary! Founded by my grandfather and now led by my father, Dan Bernstein as CEO, Bel Fuse stands as a testament to enduring success and unwavering commitment to core values.

Growing up, I had the privilege of witnessing firsthand the dedication, resilience, and integrity that fueled the family business. Here are some fundamental principles that have been passed down through generations, shaping not only Bel's journey but also my approach as an Operating Partner in the private equity space:

- Respecting the Team: Bel has always believed in treating employees like family. This deep respect for the team has fostered a culture of loyalty, collaboration, and mutual growth. It's a principle I hold dear, knowing that a company's true strength lies in its people. 

- Running the Business the Right Way: Integrity has always been at the heart of Bel Fuse. My grandfather's mantra of doing business the right way‚Äîfairly, ethically, and transparently‚Äîhas been a cornerstone of success. This ethos guides my interactions and decisions as I work with founders to build sustainable and ethical businesses.

- Balancing Conservatism with Aggression: One of the most valuable lessons I've learned is the art of balancing conservative strategies with calculated risks. My father has and continues to excel at identifying moments to be bold while maintaining a prudent approach. This balance is crucial in driving growth without compromising stability.

- Consistent Leadership and Values: The importance of consistent leadership and adherence to core values cannot be overstated. At Bel Fuse, leadership is not just about steering the company but embodying the values that have been their foundation. I strive to bring this consistency to portcos I partner with, ensuring that the companies I support stay true to their roots while evolving for future success.

As I reflect on these invaluable lessons, I am filled with pride and gratitude. They have not only shaped Bel Fuse's legacy but also equipped me to support other founders on their journeys. In my current role, I leverage these insights to help entrepreneurs navigate challenges, seize opportunities, and build businesses that stand the test of time.

Here's to 75 years of Bel Fuse‚Äîand to many more years of leadership, integrity, and success!

#BelHistory #Leadership #FamilyBusiness #Values #PrivateEquity #Legacy #BusinessGrowth #EmployeeFirst #CustomerFocus #Innovation

From Senior Prom to Senior (Young!) Citizens: A 53-Year Love Story

As we mark Loving Day today, June 12th, I am reminded of the enduring power of love and resilience.¬†In November 1971, a few years after the landmark Loving v. Virginia decision, considered one of the most significant legal decisions of the¬†civil rights era, a senior boy asked a junior girl on a date (my/our first date). We attended a concert by Motown‚Äôs one and only Temptations (the original singers, I might add!), which turned tempting parents on their heels. We were high school students at a Catholic school, and our decision to go on a date was met with significant backlash. The school administration and several parents expressed dissatisfaction, calling the school to voice their disapproval. Yet, amidst the uproar, my parents, originally from Alabama, and his parents, from Montana, stood by us.

Some civil rights history: In 1958, Richard Loving, a white man, and Mildred Loving, a Black woman, were married in Washington, D.C., where interracial marriage was legal. Upon their return to Virginia, they were arrested and charged with violating the state's anti-miscegenation laws, specifically the Racial Integrity Act of 1924. This law prohibited marriages between white and non-white individuals, reflecting the entrenched racial segregation of the time.
The Lovings‚Äîhow fitting that their last name was Loving‚Äîwere sentenced to one year in prison, with the sentence suspended on the condition that they leave Virginia for 25 years.

Unwilling to accept this injustice, they challenged the conviction, leading to a Supreme Court ruling on June 12, 1967. The Court unanimously declared Virginia's anti-miscegenation laws unconstitutional, stating that such laws violated the Equal Protection and Due Process Clauses of the Fourteenth Amendment. Chief Justice Earl Warren asserted, "The freedom to marry, or not marry, a person of another race resides with the individual and cannot be infringed by the State." Reflecting on this historic decision, it's sobering to consider how today's Supreme Court might view such a ruling.

Note: It wasn't until 2000 that Alabama officially removed its anti-miscegenation law from the books through a public referendum, underscoring the deep-rooted racism and resistance to interracial marriages even decades after the Loving decision.

Our journey from that first date in 1971 to celebrating our 45th wedding anniversary this summer is a testament to us and to the progress and challenges that remain in society. We have been together for almost 53 years, dating nearly eight years before getting married. We continue to witness the good, bad, and ugly societal attitudes toward #interracial and same-sex relationships.

We hope that by sharing our journey, we can educate and inspire others about the importance of love, equality, and the ongoing fight against #discrimination in the broader struggle for marriage equality for everyone.

After a three-month hiatus, former Goldman Sachs executive Beth Hammack has landed her next gig as CEO and president of the Federal Reserve Bank of Cleveland.

Hammack's departure from Goldman in February was just the latest sign that the glass ceiling at the investment bank is still impenetrable. Despite its pledges to diversify its management ranks, Goldman has never had a female chair, CEO, president or CFO.

I wrote for Bloomberg Opinion at the time that we don‚Äôt know exactly why Hammack decided to leave, but we have plenty of clues. The company passed her over as CFO in 2021, instead moving Hammack into a position it claimed would eventually lead to a more senior role. (Spoiler alert: it didn‚Äôt.) And that‚Äôs despite being described by colleagues and industry insiders as a ‚Äúunique talent who dedicated her life to the firm,‚Äù a ‚Äúdeep intellect‚Äù and ‚Äúbound for higher office.‚Äù

She was said to have lacked ‚Äúthe swagger‚Äù of Goldman‚Äôs high-fliers and kept her ‚Äúties to a number of illustrious industry figures under close wrap," encapsulating the lose-lose position in which women at Hammack‚Äôs level frequently find themselves. Too little swagger and she‚Äôs considered ‚Äúatypical‚Äù for Goldman; too much and¬†research¬†suggests she would risk being marked as overly ambitious.

The most striking and cringe-worthy anecdote I read about Hammack came from a former Goldman executive who told Bloomberg News in 2020: ‚ÄúShe‚Äôs brilliant and she can explain the most complicated things in standard English. Once I thought of challenging her and asked if she could explain something in a Haiku.‚Äù

There‚Äôs a metaphor there ‚Äî the impossible standards women at the top are held to, the extra mile they are asked to go, how little their time is valued. And no surprise, Hammack delivered the haiku first thing the next morning. So why did she leave? Maybe she just got tired jumping through all those hoops and never landing at the top.

So about six weeks ago, we decided to launch Joseph‚Äôs Challenge - No Limits. The intention was to raise ¬£100k and the challenge is for Joseph, who has Down Syndrome, to try and run 10x10ks in 10 countries in 5 days at the end of August starting from a running base of zero.

If you want to support him please donate at
 https://gofund.me/5cc8d709 and if you want to follow Joseph‚Äôs progress, please follow him at https://lnkd.in/eUVjyueH.

The fundraising has gone so well that,including pledges, we are very nearly at our initial target of ¬£100k and are now in the process of launching plans to create a social enterprise to support adults with special needs with training and employment opportunities in addition to hiring a disability sports officer. Massive thanks to all who have donated so far.

It‚Äôs been a big week this week with Joseph recovering from a knee injury, appearing on BBC and being a guest of the wonderful Chair of the FA, Debbie Hewitt in the Royal Box at Wembley receiving a signed Harry Kane shirt in recognition of his fundraising efforts so far. Joseph says he is more famous than his three sisters now‚Ä¶.

We are also able to announce our first official partner, the wonderful Travelcounsellors, who are going to help manage the logistics of getting to 10 countries in 5 days with one or two jogs in between !!

We chose the title No Limits for this fundraising because when Joseph was born he spent three weeks in special care, didn‚Äôt walk until he was nearly three and everything we were told and read was about the limitations of a child with DS.

Lessons learned so far :

1) I am not very good on Instagram (I am managing Joseph‚Äôs Challenge account) - my youngest daughter tells me it‚Äôs sad to be following more people than follow you so please help me by following Joseph‚Äôs Challenge
2) I love the fact I am at an age where I don‚Äôt care about 1) !!!
3) Some people think it‚Äôs wrong to put someone like Joseph through a challenge like this - all I say to them is if you want to take him on at butterfly go for it !!!!
4) Most people are incredibly kind and go out of their way to support you when you put yourself out there
5) I am still afraid of failure and won‚Äôt relax until we have a social enterprise up and running
6) Joseph has taught us that if you go for 1% improvements and don‚Äôt cap your expectations or focus on a single target, you can really surprise yourself
7) Dont be afraid to ask so please donate !!!!
8) I have no idea how hashtags work but here goes ! #josephschallenge #travelcounsellors #nolimits #disabilitysports

For the past 21 years, I‚Äôve had this 1960‚Äôs board game framed just outside my personal office Spanx. Every time I walk past it, it‚Äôs a reminder of how far we‚Äôve come. ‚Å£
‚Å£
It came out 5 years before I was born. There are six career options for women; a ballerina, model, actress, flight attendant, nurse and teacher. At the time this board game came out, it was very progressive because women weren‚Äôt encouraged to work at all. THIS WAS NOT THAT LONG AGO!!! Let this reminder be what fuels you to dream big, take risks, be bold, disrupt industries, invent, redefine the conventional image and definition of success, and never let fear hold you back from trying new things or from becoming the best version of yourself. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Think of all the women who came before us that never got the chance. Every day I wake up with gratitude for more options, and deeply appreciate the women and men who came before me who spoke up, showed up, and pushed society to allow women to be deemed worthy enough to vote, worthy enough to get a business loan, and ultimately decide what they want to become. ‚Å£
‚Å£
#Gratitude #WomenEmpowerment‚Å£

After working for start-ups for over 10 years, I decided to take a sabbatical in 2023.  During my time off I focused on recentering myself through mindfulness, exercise and healthy habits.  Thank you to my ‚Äúperson‚Äù and wife, Kelly James, for all your support.

At the 1 year mark, I started thinking about what I wanted to do next.  If I was going back to work, I wanted my experience to be enjoyable and fulfilling where I could help create something and make a difference.  I loved the sense of satisfaction of working with local and state governments and knew I wanted to stay in GovTech and with a smaller pre-IPO organization.

After a few months of research and discussions to identify my new adventure, I‚Äôm excited to share that I am starting a new position as Principal Customer Success Manager at Clariti.  Thank you Boaz S. Maor for the introduction to Clariti.  I am looking forward to working with Claytie Mistry (Moorman) and her Customer Experience Team.

The best in the world are the most ok with being horrible first.

Check out Ed Sheeran‚Äôs first song:

I love this video because it shows that someone who is considered incredibly talented NOW was absolutely awful early.

He got good by practicing incredibly hard - not just because of natural abilities.

Most of the great joys in my life are on the other side of being horrible at them early. Being an entrepreneur. Writing online. Helping CEOs solve problems.

Question:

What are you resisting doing more of that you really enjoy - but that you are awful at today?

I bet you are not as bad as Ed Sheeran‚Äôs first song.

Get after it. I‚Äôm rooting for you.

If this post resonates with you, share ‚ôªÔ∏è this post and follow Matt Schnuck for insights on entrepreneurship, EQ and from 25 years in business.

One of the best things here is thinking long term. This has allowed us to make some bold moves in the past, like:
- Only focusing on B2B (working with Clients to offer Wellhub as a benefit to employees)
- Upgrading all subscribers to a new micro-services tech platform (that engages more people with wellbeing and increases check-ins)
- Investing in digital partnerships to complement the amazing offering we have with in person fitness and wellness partners!

And now, changing the name of the entire business to Wellhub. An obvious decision considering a multi-year perspective.

Got my welcome to Wellhub kit today!

It's day 1.

I'm feeling fresh to takle our mission to make every company a wellness company and help employees check-in with their wellbeing everyday.

column2:
AI is not some sort of natural phenomenon that will just emerge and become dangerous.
*WE* design it and *WE* build it.

I can imagine thousands of scenarios where a turbojet goes terribly wrong.
Yet we managed to make turbojets insanely reliable before deploying them widely.

The question is similar for AI:
 "do we think there exists at least one design of an AI system that is simultaneously safe/controllable, and can fulfill objectives in more intelligent ways than humans ?"
If the answer is yes, we'll be fine.
If the answer is no, we won't build it.
Right now, we don't even have a hint of a design of a human-level intelligent system.

So it's too early to worry about it.
And it's way too early to regulate it to prevent "existential risk."

column2:
Une Coupe de Cheveux en Provence (with help from GPT-4o and Claude 3.5 Sonnet)

In days past, a classic consulting firm interview question involved quantitative estimation, such as asking how many gas stations there are in New York.

I decided to test the quantitative reasoning skills of GPT-4o and Claude 3.5 Sonnet with a similar question: ‚ÄúWhat is the size of a town in Provence that might support 2-3 barbers or hair salons?‚Äù

GPT-4o reasoned that a barber shop or salon might handle 15 clients a day, 5 days a week, and that potential clients might get a haircut every two months, resulting in an estimate of 600 clients per shop, and 1,200 to 1,800 clients for 2-3 shops.

GPT-4o: ‚ÄúFor instance, a town like Crestet, which has a population of around 400 (as of recent estimates), would likely not support 2-3 salons on its own, but nearby larger towns might.‚Äù

‚ÄúGiven Crestet's small size, you might look for nearby towns such as:

Vaison-la-Romaine: A larger town approximately 15 minutes away, with a population of around 6,000 people, which likely supports multiple barbers and hair salons.

Carpentras: About 30 minutes away, with a population of around 30,000, offering many more options.

Final Recommendation:

For a reliable haircut experience, consider driving to Vaison-la-Romaine or Carpentras, where you will find several barbers and hair salons catering to a larger population. This ensures you have multiple options to choose from.‚Äù

Finally, it produced the image below.


Claude 3.5 Sonnet asserted that ‚Äú[a] typical hair salon can serve about 100-200 regular clients‚Äù and assumed that ‚Äúpeople get haircuts every 6-8 weeks on average.‚Äù

Using the midpoints of those ranges, it got to 3,375 people to support 2-3 shops.  It then noted that in ‚Äúmore rural areas like Provence, people might travel further for services.  We should add a buffer to account for this: let's say 20%.

3,375 * 1.2 = 4,050 people‚Äù

Finally, it rounded up for a conservative estimate:  ‚ÄúTo ensure the town can comfortably support 2-3 salons, let's round up.

A town of about 4,500-5,000 people should be able to support 2-3 barbers or hair salons in a rural French setting like Provence.‚Äù

It did an excellent job of identifying 5 nearby towns as options, based on population and driving distance, and concluded:

‚ÄúAmong these options, Vaison-la-Romaine is likely your best bet, given its proximity and adequate size to support multiple hair salons. Orange and Carpentras, while slightly farther, offer more options due to their larger populations. Nyons is a good middle-ground option, while Buis-les-Baronnies might be worth checking if you prefer a smaller town setting.‚Äù


My assessment: GPT-4o did a better job on the estimation portion of the problem and on the image, and Claude 3.5 Sonnet came up with a nice set of towns.  Based on these analyses, I am heading to Vaison-la-Romaine and will report back in the comments.


#technology #ai #innovation #france

AI-powered Credit Cards?! (Concept)

Imagine an AI-powered credit card with augmented reality (AR) that displays your balance and other stats when you hold it close, visible only to you.

While this concept by Volodymyr Kurbatov isn't real yet, it would be amazing to have AR and AI technology integrated into our everyday financial tools. Such advancements are likely on the horizon, but privacy and security will be the main concerns to address before this becomes a reality.

Follow Endrit Restelica for more tech stuff.

I am excited to share with all our entrepreneurs, partners and friends that today Telstra Ventures starts a new chapter in our journey, changing our name to Titanium Ventures üö®
 
We chose Titanium Ventures because it best represents who we are, who we want to be and the founders we back - strong, resilient people, who resist cracking under pressure, building enduring companies. 
 
Titanium has the highest durability and strength-to-weight ratio of any metal in the world and like the leaders we invest in, we punch way above our weight.
 
Our investment thesis remains the same and we will continue to identify and scale the most promising companies across a variety of AI, digital and software sectors.
 
So far we‚Äôve invested in 99 portfolio companies, resulting in:
 
üöÄ 12 IPOs

Today we have almost US$1B funds under management and have returned US$678M cash to investors.

Against the backdrop of a growing food cold storage market, EQT is pleased to announce the #acquisition of Constellation Cold Logistics, the third largest cold storage owner-operator in Europe. 

Constellation provides temperature-controlled storage infrastructure to a wide-range of food producers via a network of 26 storage facilities across seven countries in Western Europe and the Nordics. It offers critical food preservation services that are essential to the modern food supply chain, helping to feed the world safely while reducing food waste.

EQT will support Constellation as it looks to further entrench its market-leading position, execute identified M&A opportunities and deliver major expansion developments within Europe. Learn more here: https://ow.ly/8AJX50So3CC

"Hi Miguel, welcome to day 7. Here are relevant training options based on your onboarding questionnaire."

New in Microsoft Copilot Studio: create copilots that act as agents üöÄ

Copilot agents orchestrate complex business processes. They act as independent agents working for you to look up information, reason over data, and use generative AI to kick off the appropriate chain of actions in response.

For example, an employee onboarding copilot:
- üì§ Gets trigged from a new hire event
- üëã Sends introduction message with personalized onboarding plan
-  üìä Reasons over data to answer employee questions
- üìö Recommends personalized training based on employee background

The underlaying capabilities that make it all possible:
- ùó¢ùóøùó∞ùóµùó≤ùòÄùòÅùóøùóÆùòÅùó∂ùóºùóª ùóºùó≥ ùó∞ùóºùó∫ùóΩùóπùó≤ùòÖ ùòÅùóÆùòÄùó∏ùòÄ. Use generative AI to plan and reason to manage complex, multistep tasks.
- ùó†ùó≤ùó∫ùóºùóøùòÜ ùóÆùóªùó± ùó∞ùóºùóªùòÅùó≤ùòÖùòÅ. One frustrating thing about support is having to repeat yourself many times. Copilots learn from previous history to personalize interactions, so you don't need to repeat yourself every single time.
- ùó†ùóºùóªùó∂ùòÅùóºùóøùó∂ùóªùó¥ ùóÆùóªùó± ùó∂ùó∫ùóΩùóøùóºùòÉùó∂ùóªùó¥.¬†Copilots can learn and adapt, providing a comprehensive history of its activities. You can see what actions and decisions it made -- and correct and teach them with just a few clicks.
- ùóóùó≤ùóπùó≤ùó¥ùóÆùòÅùó∂ùóºùóª ùòÑùó∂ùòÅùóµ ùó∞ùóºùóªùó≥ùó∂ùó±ùó≤ùóªùó∞ùó≤ ùóÆùóªùó± ùó¥ùòÇùóÆùóøùó±ùóøùóÆùó∂ùóπùòÄ. Copilots operate strictly within the defined instruction, knowledge, and actions, and maintain stringent security measures and controls.

Given the 240-year history of the Bank of New York, we are fascinated by the perseverance that has defined our company.

Let this history inspire us to apply excellent engineering principles to all we do. Remember that quality is a habit more so than a performance. We work at it not occasionally but always, tenaciously, and resiliently.

Imbedding quality into what we do is a marathon, not a sprint.
Above all, one needs resilience. It also demands for patience. Accept the challenges, learn from our mistakes, and never give up on improving moving forward.

Best assets of BNY are its #people and its #resilience. Collaborating, we can protect BNY tradition and encourage originality and excellence in whatever we do.

I am deeply pleased to share that I have graduated from the ITSMF - Information Technology Senior Management Forum Management Academy. My profound gratitude goes to Bank of America for the unwavering investment in my professional development. This support not only enhances my capabilities but also inspires me to contribute more meaningfully each day to my teammates and the community in which we live and work.

The ITSMF Management Academy offers Black IT leaders a truly transformative journey. Over the past ten months, alongside my 76 cohort members‚Äîaffectionately known as the Phoenix 76‚Äîwe embarked on an intense and immersive experience that underscored ITSMF's mission to transform the mind, body, and soul. Through 26 assignments, over ten book readings, executive and book presentations, leader-to-leader sessions, and monthly cohort calls, our directors, Dr Turner and Shakeer Abdullah, Ph.D. challenged us to lead ourselves first before leading others. Their dedication delivered a leadership program that was both rigorous and methodical, transforming us from the inside out. One particularly impactful aspect was the unfiltered feedback, which was both constructive and compassionate.

To cap it off, I was humbled to receive the ITSMF Global Citizenship Award. This honor fuels my resolve and inspires me to continue showing up selflessly for those around me.

I would like to honor a few individuals who made this experience unforgettable:

‚Ä¢ My leader, Terrelle Carswell has been my staunch advocate throughout this journey. His support, advocacy, and encouragement have been invaluable.

‚Ä¢ My accountability partner in the program, Zena Kyles, MBA, PMP, epitomizes strength and resolve. She taught me to put aside excuses and simply show up.

‚Ä¢ My executive mentor, Tonya Bryant, challenged me to aim high. Her encouragement to continually pursue growth and learning was invaluable.

To my Phoenix 76 family: Our ten-month metamorphosis required us to trust the process. We finished strong because we learned to humbly sharpen each other to excel and thrive. Our journey to the elevated altitude didn't leave us gasping for air; instead, we learned to release our burdens and blind spots so we could soar like the Phoenix. As we've reached this mountainous milestone, remember, we were not meant to stay at the top. The real work is just beginning. As John Maxwell wisely said, "We didn't get this far, to only get this far."

I'm excited to share that we've been retained to find candidates for Carilion Clinic's CISO position. 

 Carilion Clinic, headquartered in Roanoke, Virginia, includes a comprehensive network of 250+ locations that provide quality care close to home for nearly one million Virginians and West Virginians. 

Over the next seven years, Carilion Clinic is investing more than $1 billion in the region through expanding and modernizing its buildings, including an almost-500,000 square foot expansion to Carilion Roanoke Memorial Hospital.

The CISO is a key member of the SVP/CIO's senior leadership team, responsible for maturing and overseeing a comprehensive information technology security program across the enterprise.

The CISO will lead a dedicated security team of approximately 18 people, collaborating closely with other departments on IT security matters.

Join the team at UW Health as their Director of Human Resources Information Systems. 

UW Health is an integrated health system with a total of nine hospitals and four medical centers in Wisconsin and Illinois. They are affiliated with the University of Wisconsin‚ÄìMadison.

Reporting to the VP of HR Operations, the Director will lead a team of 11 direct reports. 

The Director will play a strategic leadership role in shaping the HR technology ecosystem and will have the opportunity to lead transformative HR technology initiatives, including:

- Oracle Cloud implementation and optimization across UW Health‚Äôs Wisconsin and Northern Illinois locations
- Expansion of the ServiceNow platform within Human Resources
- Exploring AI and generative AI for HR processes
- Ensuring compliance and evolution of HRIS systems as technologies change

The position is remote with the expectation to be onsite once a quarter.

Successful leaders in this role will have excellent communication and negotiation skills, along with strong project management and vendor management abilities.  They also need to be innovative, collaborative, and able to thrive in a fast-paced environment.

column2:
üåü Exciting News! üåü

I am thrilled to share that the Board of Directors of the Healthcare Information and Management Systems Society (HIMSS) has approved my application for advancement to Fellow Member status!

This prestigious honor is a recognition of my service, professional participation, job experience, publications, and presentations within the healthcare information and management systems field. I am deeply grateful for this acknowledgment and for the support of my colleagues, mentors, and the entire HIMSS community.

This milestone would not have been possible without the collaborative spirit and shared dedication of the incredible teams and professionals I have had the privilege to work with throughout my career. Your partnership and encouragement have been instrumental in this journey.

Thank you, HIMSS, for this honor and for inspiring me to strive for greater heights. I look forward to continuing to serve our society and our profession with the same passion, enthusiasm, and commitment to excellence. Together, we can make a significant impact on the future of healthcare.

#HIMSS #HealthcareIT #FellowMember #ProfessionalGrowth #HealthcareInnovation #Gratitude #CareerMilestone

column2:
Improve Digital Health Cyber Resiliency to Effectively Prevent, Detect, and Respond to Ransomware Attacks: https://lnkd.in/gtFWBSXt

As a leading competitor for digital health cyber resiliency solutions, First Health focuses on controls and cyber posture to inform the most effective approach to incident response planning and ransomware resiliency. Our cyber clinicians review the client's current tools, controls, policies, and procedures to align them with contemporary ransomware technology and tactics. Our team helps clients to address key risk factors, backup patient data, and develop clinical playbooks to assure downtime procedures will be effective in the event of a shutdown. First Health clients receive actionable technical and strategic recommendations to reduce the likelihood and impact of ransomware to improve overall cyber resilience and protection of critical assets.

For more on First Health's Ransomware Prevention, Recovery, & Resiliency Services, visit https://lnkd.in/gtFWBSXt or contact sales@firsthealthadvisory.com

Since the 1980s, or olden days as my gen alpha daughter says,  many organizations have followed the maxim that leaders learn 70 percent of their skills on the job, 20 percent through social interaction, and only 10 percent through formal training courses. 

What's even more interesting is over the next 3-5 years, approximately a 3rd of the workforce will require reskilling, and yes, this includes leaders. ü§Ø

üåéThe world is changing and we as leaders must be equipped to not simply respond, but also lead what I refer to as the Human Ops Revolution.

üí°Join the esteemed faculty and your peers to learn what you should be doing to prepare for this shift in your organization! 

Register today using the link below. If you're on the fence about attending, don't hesitate to reach out to myself, Mike Mosquito, CHCIO, MBA, PMP, CDH-E, Timothy R. Zoph , Terri Couts, RN-BC MHA, Donna M. Roach, MS, CHCIO, CDH-E, LFCHIME, LFHIMSS or Nicole Kerkenbush ! 

We are looking forward to seeing you in Salt Lake City!

Had a great week in Detroit celebrating Comerica Bank's 175th Anniversary!!  It was an excellent opportunity to hear from our senior leaders and have quality face to face conversations with many of my business partners.  I was very lucky to share a selfie with Cassandra McKinney, Executive Director Comerica's Retail Bank.

I also got to have in person engagements with other great business partners that I collaborate virtually with most of the time including Frank King, Adam Pichler, Allysun Fleming, Jim Weber, Brenda Christmas, Maria Adams, Joshua Anderson, Peter Sefzik, Saba Dossani, and Mosh√© Dickerman.  We really are #OneComerica!

My new motto, ‚ÄúSuccess is a team sport!‚Äù

#leadership #success #getthingsdone

Last week‚Äôs highlight was my trip to the high-spirited cities of Southeast Michigan! ‚úãüèæ

Our passionate Comerica Bank executive leaders and I always jump at the chance to connect with one another, share our team‚Äôs success, explore opportunities for growth, and discuss the future of banking. You can definitely mark this One Comerica Meets as another success. ‚úÖ

Of course, I also stopped into some of our banking centers to meet new colleagues and see familiar faces. It‚Äôs illuminating to see our customer-facing #Comericans in action and witness the solutions and service they deliver firsthand. Their passion, commitment, and drive are a force to be reckoned with.

At #Comerica, we‚Äôre more than just bankers; we‚Äôre trusted advisors, partners, doers, collaborators, and the list goes on. Thank you to Peter Sefzik, LARRY FRANCO, Larry Bryant, Marvin Rushing, Stacey Willey, Joseph Couck, Linda Fletcher and our Retail Operations Managers for joining us and everyone who made this visit one to remember.

And the icing on the cake was to celebrate our 175 Year Anniversary with over 1000 colleagues! We were treated to the talented performance of the Detroit Children‚Äôs Choir. Congratulations to Shelly Pisors and the team for another successful event!

#ComericaBank #MarketVisits #Michigan #IWorkForComerica

Come join us and be a part of a progressive roadmap, as we build and reimagine the future of Digital Engineering here at Comerica! Lots of exciting work to be done and a great leadership opportunity. AWS cloud experience and certification required! DM me for questions!

Cheers to the 2024 High School Grads just starting to make their own way! üéâüéì
Life is busy, messy, stressful, nonstop, a constant puzzle of fitting in the moments of time to be everything to everyone, playing different roles in the many facets that life brings.  My closest friends get glimpses of our blessed #WaughFamilyLife on other social networks, but today I find it fitting to celebrate with this community, on our oldest son Preston's, high school graduation! üéì It was truly a blessing to see and reminded me of why this life of craziness is so worth it.  This kid is brilliant, bright, funny, kind, strong, fearless and makes us so proud.  Our family is as close as family can be, so it's not surprising that he has chosen to follow his parent's footsteps in attending CMU in the Fall pursuing a Computer Science degree.  Fire Up Chips!  There will be no limit to his success and he will have our unconditional love and support through all of what life throws his way.  Cheers to all the grads this year as they pursue their futures and ultimately make the world a better place.  And cheers to those shaping the lives of youth, it is the best feeling in the world when you see them succeed! üåé‚ù§Ô∏è
column23: Congratulations to Preston and the proud family! Good luck for everything!

It was an honor to help represent Comerica Bank in conjunction with Tech United and United Way for Southeastern Michigan as we collectively distributed another 220+ laptops to children in Detroit. Huge thank you to Anup Popat, Tonya Adair, Andre Ebron, MSOL, CDE, Levi Stubbs III for allowing me to be a part a amazing opportunity for the last 18 months. Thank you Bruce Mitchell for the constant and unrelenting support needed to achieve well over 1,000 devices since Comerica's inception of our program.

Tech United has an aspirational goal of conquering the digital divide in the Detroit area in which we believe the catalyst is getting a 1 to 1 ratio of computer to student which enables technology to be part of their everyday lives, not just a class in school or an assignment.

Thank you to Detroit Edison Public School Academy for allowing us to visit your beautiful school and interact with some of your students, meeting Dr. Bland was treat as well to hear the story of the building starting at a tomato plant and now the home for 1000+ scholars focused on their future and the future of the local community.

Thank you to follow Comerica colleagues for attending with me and supporting this effort Derek Calus, Audrey Sims-Carr, Ryan Smoyer, and Ryan Orkwis. We could never imagine doing this work at this scale without Derek and Audrey carrying the load each and ever day.
I recently took the step to earn my Lean Six Sigma Certification after supporting and championing numerous projects for others. #ContinuousImprovement #ProcessOptimization

This is a powerful lesson in confidence and grace from my ten-year-old.

A lot of times we learn something from our children and this is one of them. My ten year old daughter at school was told that ‚Äúyou are ugly‚Äù by a girl leading a group of other girls.

I was upset and broken down for a second with lot of thoughts hitting my head until she continued her remaining conversation‚Ä¶

My girl instantly responded that yes ‚ÄúI‚Äôm trying to look like you today‚Äú and the other girl got mad and said that ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt stand you anymore‚Äù And my girl said ‚Äúthen please sit down‚Äù.

As a parent it hurts me still writing about it and at the same time I‚Äôm proud that my daughter chose to be kind, confident and resilient to harsh words.

 #confidence #kindness #resilience #uplift
column23: This is so amazing on so many levels! Hats off to your daughter for standing up for herself! She is going to be one strong independent girl just like her Mom!

This month, we are celebrating the 10th anniversary of the Frost App! Here at Frost, we strive to provide the best experiences possible, both in person and on the go!

‚ÄúI‚Äôm thrilled to celebrate the 10th anniversary of the Frost App. The original version was created through some of the best teamwork I have ever seen by a group of Frost Bankers who were obsessed with creating something our customers would love. We‚Äôve never lost the spirit of that first team. Our current team works tirelessly to create simple and beautiful experiences that make people‚Äôs lives better. And we‚Äôve never lost the personal touch. Our mobile team is immersed with our customers, constantly striving to understand how the app can get better and better. It‚Äôs this customer-driven innovation that‚Äôs helped us win the JD Power Award for Consumer Banking Satisfaction in Texas 15 times in a row,‚Äù said Jimmy Stead, Group Executive Vice President - Chief Consumer Banking Officer.

‚ÄúWe want to continually improve customer experience and to keep pace with evolving customer needs and expectations,‚Äù said Laura Miller, EVP Consumer Strategy & Digital.

Our top-rated banking app offers powerful features you‚Äôll love to use, such as the ability to send money to friends, see all your accounts in one place and chat with a human for help. Get started and download the app today.
