"At the World Championships in Budapest in June, USA‚Äôs Anita Alvarez sank to the bottom of the pool.

Looking across the deck, then noticing she was under way too long, her coach, Andrea Fuentes immediately dove in after her fully clothed, pulling her to safety. Anita was unconscious and didn‚Äôt have the capacity to kick, paddle, or help herself in any way.

If Andrea had not have noticed, she would have drown.

But she knew Anita.
She looked for her, quickly noticed she was under too long, (nore than normal)
then dove in without thinking twice.

This has resonated with me‚Ä¶.

When you are under too long, who are the people that will look for you, notice you aren't surfacing, and dive in to pull you to the surface when you lose your strength to swim in life?

Who are the people that would do that for you?

And can someone count on you to be that person that would go looking and notice when they are under too long, diving in to support them when they are all out of fight and fuel to swim in these turbulent waters we call life? "

20 yr Workiversary

Thanks to the many friends, colleagues, and clients who congratulated me over the last week regarding my 20th anniversary with Frost Bank. It‚Äôs been a great ride, and I‚Äôve no intentions of getting off any time soon.

Milestones are funny things though. I realized, for example, that I‚Äôve now worked at one place longer than I lived in my hometown of Knippa! Or, that the city I moved to (MSA of ~ 1 million in 2004), having just been ranked the fastest growing MSA in the country for a staggering 12th consecutive year, is no longer a mid sized college town, but now a burgeoning internationally recognized City of 2.4 million - with all the perks and challenges that come with that kind of growth. Or that the company I joined would evolve into a top 50 bank in the US with nearly 200 branches and industry leading people and products (see #1 in customer satisfaction JD Power rankings,  or best mortgage lender in Texas by CNN).

And when I think back on the kid I was back then, I realize just how fortunate (blessed) I‚Äôve been these past two decades to have people in my life who‚Äôve gone out of their way to help mentor and guide me along the way. While too many to thank individually, there are a few I do have to call out specifically. Ronnie Miksch, Tim Crowley, Will Ingram, Keith Donahoe, John Schawe, John Greenwood, Ken Gates -  Your kindness, direction, and coaching (yes Ro, I‚Äôm talking to you) made me the banker I am today. I‚Äôve still got lots to learn, but I owe each of you a great deal for your help along the way.

I want to close with the thought I shared with the team last Friday morning as we celebrated with some chicken minis (cause everyone loves those things!). And that is, I‚Äôm more optimistic today about the future here at Frost than I‚Äôve ever been. It feels like Frost, and specifically the Austin team, is having our moment in the spotlight, as we hire up and grow across the region. I couldn‚Äôt be prouder of the people I get to do that with, and if you need a good bank to help you, or your company, give me a call, I genuinely would love to help.

Cheers y‚Äôall.

-david

Today marks my 30-year anniversary with Frost a testament to our enduring #culture of integrity, caring, and excellence, and the power of building lasting relationships. Throughout my journey, I've had the privilege of serving in almost 15 positions, making lifelong friends, and being supported by incredible mentors and leaders.

I've learned along the way to pay attention to what matters most to our customers, understand the results of decisions, collaborate with others to deliver the best outcome, stay true to myself, and honor the legacies of others. The countless opportunities provided have showcased the abundant impact Frost makes on so many lives.

Our mission at Frost is to make all people‚Äôs lives better in the communities we serve, and I have personally been the recipient time and time again of that mission.

I am deeply thankful to everyone who has patiently guided and supported me on this remarkable journey. Your support has been invaluable, and I am forever grateful.

2024 is the 12th year of my career with GlobalFoundries. The recent 4-5 years have been filled with many difficult challenges and the immense satisfaction of getting the various cross functional teams through those hurdles in different situations. I‚Äôm thankful to the team for having confidence in me and to GlobalFoundries for recognizing those efforts. Four CEO Awards in the last five years and 3 in a row since 2021!! Thanks Tom Caulfield and the team üòä.

Excited to share CNN Underscored named Frost as one of the best #mortgage lenders in #Texas this year! The recognition is based on key factors like mortgage rates, loan types, eligibility and customer service options. So, why did they choose us?

- Heritage and Expertise: Frost has been serving the financial needs of Texans for more than 150 years, and we‚Äôre thrilled to be back in the mortgage game since late 2023.

- Diverse Mortgage Options: We offer conforming and jumbo mortgages, plus our unique Progress Mortgage, designed to meet the needs of all Texans.

- Unmatched Customer Service: Our customers trust us, ranking us highest among Texas banks in J.D. Power‚Äôs retail banking satisfaction study for the past 15 years.


Read more about why Frost is among the top mortgage lenders in Texas in the article below. If you‚Äôre in the market for a home and interested in exploring our options, I‚Äôd be happy to connect you with a #Frost mortgage loan advisor.

I am writing in memory of my wife, Karla Johnson, who left us on May 31, 2024, at the age of 54. Karla was an incredible wife and mother to our two sons, Collin Johnson and Connor Johnson. During our 32 years of marriage, I witnessed her love and generosity touch everyone she met.

Karla devoted her life to helping others and had a particular passion for pets, especially German Shepherds. Her commitment to education and pet shelters was a testament to her generous spirit. Karla was not only the family planner and holiday host but also a loving sister and daughter who brought joy and love to every moment.

Many have asked about how to honor her memory. In lieu of flowers, Karla would have preferred donations to her scholarship fund. This non-profit ensures that 100% of the contributions go directly to deserving scholarship recipients.

Since 1990, the Marlboro Mill has been an industry and corporate leader. It‚Äôs also the last greenfield mill built in the United States. Learn more about what makes this pulp and paper mill unique: https://ow.ly/OTMg50S7Jky

üåü¬†LEADERSHIP MEMBER HIGHLIGHT¬†üåü

Qing Wang, Ph.D., PMP - Chair of IFT Food Microbiology Division

We are thrilled to spotlight Dr. Qing Wang, the Chair of the IFT Food Microbiology Division (FMD). An IFT member since 2010, Dr. Wang has been a vital part of the FMD since 2018, serving in various leadership roles.

Dr. Wang holds an MS in Food Safety from the University of Georgia and a Ph.D. in Food Microbiology from the University of Delaware. She began her professional journey at Sealed Air in 2016 as a Senior Microbiologist, where she led global projects and delivered specialized food safety training and consultancy. Transitioning to Solvay USA Inc. in 2021, and later Syensqo, she continues her microbiology background and expertise in developing biological formulations for agriculture, and driving innovation in the development of new 24-hour surface disinfectant technologies.

Dr. Wang's exceptional contributions have earned her the IFT Emerging Leader Award (2019) and Outstanding Volunteer Award (2021). She also serves as a judge for the IFT Bernard L. Oser Food Ingredient Safety Award and the IFT FMD Graduate Oral Competition. With her expertise and passion, Dr. Wang is committed to taking the FMD to new levels, and we are excited to be part of it.

After 11 incredible years, the time has come for me to say goodbye to Franciscan Inpatient Team at Virginia Mason Franciscan Health. This transition has been a time for me to reflect on my journey and be grateful for the opportunities and relationships I have had on my way!

The camaraderie I've received from my colleagues has been instrumental in my professional and personal development. Together, we have navigated challenges, celebrated successes, and continually strived to provide the highest quality of care to our patients. 

I want to extend my heartfelt thanks to every team member, colleague and friend I've had the privilege of working with. Your collaboration, and encouragement have made me a better clinician, leader and person.

As I embark on this new chapter, I carry with me the lessons learned and the friendships formed at St Joseph Medical Center and VMFH. While leaving is bittersweet, I am excited for what the future holds and confident that the foundation built here will continue to support my growth.

I look forward to staying connected and cheering on your continued success from afar.

More than 100 colleagues from across our platform recently attended the Bain Capital U.S. Women Investors Conference, a special opportunity for connection and learning from internal and external thought leaders. John Connaughton, David Gross and Jonathan Lavine discussed the firm‚Äôs longstanding commitment to and continued investment in the careers of women investors. 

The conference also featured a conversation with leaders Carolyn Hastings, Olivia Howard, Merritt Hummer, and Kimberly McCaslin moderated by Victoria A. Budson that sought to impart reflections and perspectives from their combined 60+ years of investment experience.

Bain Capital doesn't just want to invest.¬†Its mission is to make a lasting impact and build great companies. 

The private investment firm - which was founded in 1984 and boasts $185 billion in assets under management - partners closely with management teams to improve on strategy, operations, or other key business areas.¬†Technology is one of the key sectors it focuses on and it has the flexibility to meet the needs of companies at various stages from early stage to growth to industry incumbent. 

Partners Max de Groen and Scott Kirk leverage their deep experience and capabilities to ensure companies succeed for the long term. 

Find out how Bain Capital elevates the tech industry from a deeper level.

Since our founding in 2012, the security of our customers‚Äô data has been our highest priority. That‚Äôs why the recent cyber security threat targeting some of our customers has been unsettling, especially given that we, and cybersecurity experts Mandiant (part of Google Cloud) and CrowdStrike, have found no evidence to suggest that unauthorized access to Snowflake customer accounts stemmed from a breach of Snowflake's enterprise environment.

Mandiant released their investigative report on the threat on June 10th confirming our preliminary findings that we had begun sharing with our customers on May 24th.

Key Mandiant findings include:

‚ñ™ Every incident Mandiant responded to associated with this campaign was traced back to compromised customer credentials.
‚ñ™ The impacted accounts were not configured with multi-factor authentication enabled, meaning successful authentication only required a valid username and password.
‚ñ™ Credentials identified in infostealer malware output were still valid, in some cases years after they were stolen, and had not been rotated or updated.
‚ñ™ The impacted Snowflake customer instances did not have network allow lists in place to only allow access from trusted locations.

We operate under a shared responsibility security model with our customers ‚Äì with them having the responsibility to follow best practices when configuring networks and enforcing secure authentication methods for access to their systems ‚Äì and now we plan to strengthen this model by requiring more stringent protections.

In the coming weeks, we will be providing a feature for administrators of Snowflake accounts to make multi-factor authentication (MFA) mandatory for all users; ultimately moving to MFA by default. While we target to roll out the enhanced authentication policies by the end of June, we are going to do this in a controlled and staged way alongside close communication and enablement. By doing so, we‚Äôll not only be helping our customers better protect themselves, but we‚Äôll also be leading the industry to what we believe will become an industry standard.

We are also accelerating in-product capabilities, such as our Trust Center. This new active audit and monitoring capability is expected to be generally available by the end of June, with additional transparency specifically around MFA and network policies.

This is in addition to other actions we‚Äôve already taken, like locking customer accounts where we saw cyber threat activity, working closely with affected customers to help them better protect themselves, and communicating with all of our customers to harden their security measures.

You have our commitment that the security of your data will always be our highest priority.

Thrilled to share that I am now cancer-free and on a slow and steady road to recovery. üíú üí™ 

A few months ago, a preventative MRI revealed a rare tumor on my pancreas (solid pseudopapillary neoplasm). Thanks to early detection, we acted quickly before it spread, removing just 25% of my pancreas while largely preserving my spleen and other vital organs.  The tests are back, and the cancer is gone.

Key learnings from this journey:

üîπ Proactive Health: Early detection can save lives, and in my case, it did. My cancer was found through a preventative MRI. I had no signs or symptoms of cancer, in fact I was the healthiest I'd been in years.
üîπSelf-Advocacy: If you're unsatisfied with your healthcare provider, seek a second opinion at another institution.  Advocate for yourself, even when it feels deeply uncomfortable.
üîπ¬†Empathy: You never know what someone is going through. Be kind and supportive, as they may be putting on a brave face. 
üîπ Gratitude: Immense thanks to Biograph's diligent team for the early detection, my employer and team at OpenAI for their unwavering support, my all star husband Connor O'Brien, and our friends, family, and community for standing by our family through this. Special thanks to the world-class team at Stanford University for their exceptional care through every step of my journey. Truly the best healthcare institution in the world.

Looking forward, I'm increasingly optimistic about the future of healthcare, especially with AI's potential. Numerous promising AI companies in healthcare are emerging, and I'm excited to support their growth through any way possible. I believe that AI will revolutionize healthcare, making early detection and effective treatment more accessible.

Thank you all for your support and encouragement. This experience has strengthened my resolve to live fully and prioritize health, wellness, and family. üíú

Today Entergy Texas submitted its proposal to build Legend and Lone Star Power Stations - two¬†natural gas¬†power plants¬†in Jefferson and Liberty counties. These 24/7 dispatchable resources will address the critical need for increased power generation capacity, support increased economic activity throughout the region, and pave the way for sustainable energy solutions that will benefit #SETX for decades to come.

These future-forward projects are projected to save customers approximately $370 million over the lifespan of the plants. These power stations are expected to be in service in 2028 and will bring a total of $2.8 billion in economic benefits to the region.¬†Approval of the two facilities by the Public Utility Commission of Texas will increase service reliability for all customers and support large-scale economic activity in the region like Sempra Infrastructure‚Äôs Port Arthur LNG facility.¬†The design of these plants will also enable carbon capture and hydrogen co-firing technology.

Today's filing is a critical step forward for our recently announced Southeast Texas Energy Plan, also known as #STEPahead. The strategic plan aims to add additional generation capacity to the power grid by 2028, critical transmission to get power where it‚Äôs needed, and grid-hardening projects to help Southeast Texas withstand extreme weather.

column2:
SEND ME YOUR CUTS!

I recently heard someone on a podcast about our industry say that the next generation of aspiring trailer editors needed only to hear from the young editors now working in the trailer companies because they really couldn‚Äôt relate to the editors who were cutting trailers in the 80‚Äôs.
This actually made me smile.
I am one of those editors who has been editing trailers since the early eighties and I am still cutting these days. I am also a company owner always looking for another gifted, motivated and passionate young editor dying to do what I have been blessed to do for over 40 years and join the amazing folks at Rebel.
A couple years ago, I noticed a cut that someone posted here on LinkedIn and it blew me away.
I contacted the person who had done it. He was a junior in college!
Nick Chapman interned for us the next eighteen months and I am proud to say, right after graduating is now one of our amazing editors at Rebel and kicking ass!
Recently I have been receiving amazing cuts from young editors from around the world and they were unbelieavable!
I am happy to say that next month, two high school students will be interning with us at Rebel, one coming all the way from Denmark!
So, the moral of the story is‚Ä¶connect with the people who actually have been doing what you aspire to do, no matter how long they have been doing it and keep showing them your cuts.
They can recognize talent and they are most likely the ones who will be able to provide the opportunity for you to join our amazing industry.
Keep cutting, explore, try crazy ideas, have fun!
Send me your cuts! I will give you feedback and help you hone your skills.

Memorial Day, originally known as Decoration Day, was established after the American Civil War. The first widely recognized observance was on May 30, 1868, when Major General John A. Logan, leader of an organization for Northern Civil War veterans, called for a nationwide day of remembrance. On that day, Americans were encouraged to decorate the graves of soldiers who had died in the Civil War with flowers.

For many years, I have used this day to celebrate and remember my West Point 1989 classmates who are no longer with us. They all left us too soon.

This Memorial Day weekend, if you know a parent, spouse, child, or sibling of someone who served and died, please reach out to them personally. Let them know you remember their sacrifice and that you care.

Here is the full list of my classmates who are no longer with us.

Be thou at peace.

During the session, we presented our strategies to promote accessibility to more than 200 people representing over 50 affiliated companies.

According to the World Health Organization (WHO), approximately 1.3 billion people worldwide have a disability, representing 16% of the world‚Äôs population. People with disabilities encounter numerous barriers across society, including physical, communication, legal, economic, and social barriers, among others. At P&G, we are committed to creating a more inclusive world for everyone, which includes people with visible and invisible disabilities.

Lea von Bidder was Swisspreneur's 12th guest way back in 2017, so it would be fair to call her one of our veterans. I first met her in San Francisco and she struck me as an incredibly inspiring person, motivating me to think bigger and be more ambitious.

Lea also joined some of our Swiss events throughout the years and always made sure to be giving back to the startup community. She is a real role model!

So, of course, when I first read about the AVA Women exit, I was really happy for her and her team, and then once I heard about the acquiring company declaring bankruptcy shortly afterwards, I was quite saddened at the thought of how this would affect them.

I'd been trying to get Lea on the podcast to talk about everything she's learned along the way for a while now, and it wasn't until startup days 2024 in Bern that I finally succeeded. It was touching, deeply personal and really eye-opening.

Have a listen: https://lnkd.in/dcN54HMx
-
#swisspreneur #startup #entrepreneur #podcast #startupdays #avawomen #expeerly #bankruptcy #exit

Das ist die "Secret Sauce" hinter heyMia: ü§´

Vor gut einem Jahr war heyMia nur eine Idee. Heute haben wir eine Recruiting-Plattform mit fast 4.000 Talenten und √ºber 200 Kunden. Wie haben wir das so schnell geschafft?

‚û°Ô∏è Unsere ‚ÄúSecret Sauce‚Äù: Low-Code Tools! üßô

Von Anfang an haben Lukas Wohlgemuth und ich auf Low-Code Tools gesetzt, um technologisch sehr schnell voran zu kommen und einfach iterieren zu k√∂nnen.

Das sind die wichtigsten Tools, die sich bei uns bew√§hrt haben: ‚¨áÔ∏è

üß† Airtable: Das Gehirn unseres Gesch√§fts! Damit managen wir unseren Talent-Pool und das CRM, und wir automatisieren Prozesse vom Onboarding bis zum Accounting. Mit Automation Scripts senden wir WhatsApp-Erinnerungen, berechnen Talent-Bewertungen, erstellen die Talent-Dossiers f√ºr Kunden etc.

üåê Make: Oft ben√∂tigen wir neben Airtable noch andere Services/APIs. Mit Make verbinden wir Airtable unter Anderem mit Gmail, Google Drive, Zoom, WhatsApp und PDF-Tools. So k√∂nnen wir komplexe Prozesse abbilden.

üíª Webflow: Unser Webseiten-Wizard. Die erste Version haben wir mit einem angepassten Template (schnell & g√ºnstig!) gebaut, inzwischen haben wir unser eigenes Design entwickelt und bald gehen weitere Features auf heymia.ch live.

üì± Heyflow: Unser Tool zum Erstellen interaktiver, mobil optimierter Flows. Damit f√ºhren wir Talente und Kunden durch den Onboarding-Prozess und k√∂nnen die ben√∂tigten Informationen einfach abfragen.

Als ‚Äúengineer at heart‚Äù bin ich beeindruckt, was dank Low-Code Tools heute m√∂glich ist und wie schnell man damit technisch anspruchsvolle Produkte bauen kann. Und es macht richtig Spass mit diesen Tools zu arbeiten!

Ganz ohne Coding gehts nat√ºrlich schon nicht, auch wenn die Tools das gerne so versprechen. üòÖ Mittlerweile ist unsere eigene Codebase ziemlich gewachsen. Aber h√§tten wir die Low-Code Tools nicht zur Verf√ºgung gehabt, h√§tten wir viel mehr selber entwickeln m√ºssen. Das w√§re deutlich teurer gewesen und h√§tte ein Vielfaches der Zeit ben√∂tigt... üêå

Ich kann Low-Code Tools zum Aufbau von neuen Startups/Produkten und zum Automatisieren von Prozessen also nur empfehlen. ‚úÖ

Was sind deine Erfahrungen mit Low-Code Tools?

_____
‚û°Ô∏è M√∂chtest du Low-Code Tools zuk√ºnftig in deinen Projekten oder deinem Unternehmen einsetzen, um die Effizienz zu steigern oder schnell neue digitale Produkte zu bauen? Let‚Äôs get in touch! üì•

#heyMia #recruiting #LowCode #Automation #Startup #Airtable

column2:
On November 1st, I am going to retire or as I like to call it ‚Äúre-mission‚Äù from Ascension.  It has been such an honor to serve the Catholic Health Ministry not once but twice in my career.  It was such a privilege to be able to bring my faith to work and not have to separate faith from profession.  I am so grateful to Ascension and its leadership for the opportunity provided to me.  My wife, Liz, and I are going to take a sabbatical and discern about how to re-mission for what we call our third-third.  We want to continue to serve our community and our faith in perhaps a different way than we have done so far.  Below is the announcement that Joe Impicciche sent out internally on my announcement.


Peter Leibold, Executive Vice President and Chief Advocacy Officer, is planning to leave Ascension on November 1. He will remain engaged with Ascension by serving as a member of the Ascension Foundation Board.‚Ä®‚Ä®A servant leader, Peter worked diligently to advance Ascension‚Äôs Mission and was a key leader in helping our organization navigate through and beyond the COVID-19 pandemic. Advocacy worked with Finance, Legal and Operations to clear regulatory hurdles, obtain needed flexibilities and advocate for significant provider financial relief that was essential for Ascension to serve its communities and take care of its associates.‚Ä®‚Ä®Peter joined Ascension in 2014 and led his team by emphasizing transparency, communication and results. During his tenure, he celebrated Advocacy‚Äôs role in expanding Medicaid in Oklahoma, promoting growth in supplemental payments to several of our ministries, advancing spiritual care as a supplemental Medicare benefit, and discerning with ministries how to comply with the Ethical and Religious Directives for Catholic Healthcare. Peter brought his whole self to his role, living out his deep faith by advocating for Ascension as a ministry of the church.¬†‚Ä®‚Ä®Peter is a member of the Ascension Leadership Team, Ascension Leadership Academy Community 4 and the Executive Ministry Leadership Formation Cohort 13.‚Ä®‚Ä®He received the David J. Greenburg award, the highest honor provided by the American Health Law Association (AHLA) for service to the health law bar. He has served on various foundation and church boards.¬†‚Ä®‚Ä®Before joining Ascension, Peter served as the CEO of the AHLA for 15 years and was General Counsel of the Catholic Health Association for three years.‚Ä®‚Ä®Peter‚Äôs departure in November provides Ascension time to identify and transition a successor.¬†‚Ä®‚Ä®Please join me in thanking Peter for his service to Ascension and his dedication to our Mission.

üåü Exciting New Chapter Ahead! üåü

After an incredible journey at Microsoft, I am announcing my departure from one of the most powerful, innovative, and talent-rich companies in the world. I feel truly blessed for my time here and have met so many incredible people who will remain friends for life. üèÜü•á

I have made the bold decision to leave my favorite workplace to strengthen and utilize my capabilities in transformational leadership, a passion close to my heart. I have said yes to one of Danish history‚Äôs most significant transformation cases at TDC Erhverv, where I will take on the role of Senior Vice President for Enterprise and join the Executive Board.

Starting July 1st at TDC Erhverv, my responsibility will be to accelerate the sales of end-to-end solutions and advanced services to enterprise and public customers. This initiative aims to solidify our market leadership as the only provider capable of delivering across all technologies.

There is a special reason I chose TDC Erhverv:
"TDC Erhverv is a strong and iconic brand that is on an exciting and ambitious transformation journey. My passion and strength lie in transforming organizations through modern change management, making a noticeable difference internally in the company culture and contributing to strengthening customers' digital journeys and business results. I look forward to contributing to strengthening our focus on spreading end-to-end value-based digital and AI solutions for the benefit of Danish society.‚Äù

I would like to thank Microsoft for the most developing years of my career. You are sending me out into the big world so much wiser and prepared for the challenges ahead. Thanks, from the bottom of my heart. ‚ù§Ô∏è

Thank you to the leadership, my team, my colleagues, and ALL our partners and friends in the ecosystem. You have ALL made the last 3.5 years incredible. #MemoriesForLife Together, we have built history. Thanks for everything ‚ù§Ô∏è Thanks for all your support, partnership, and innovation.

See you all again one day üëå And to all my new friends - see you soon. I‚Äôm so excited to meet you all‚Ä¶

Our life is a book consisting of many chapters. This is just one of them. üòò Remember to enjoy every step you take... We don‚Äôt know how many we will take.

‚ù§Ô∏è Thanks, AB ‚ù§Ô∏è

#NewBeginnings #TransformationalLeadership #Grateful #Microsoft #TDC #Nuuday

column2:
Zions Bank and World Trade Center Utah (WTC Utah) Crossroads of the World truly put Utah on the map as they brought some of the worlds most influential leaders

A few Highlights

‚≠êÔ∏èFormer President George W. Bush was wonderfully engaging and personable. His humor had the crowd roaring and should be a stand up comedian, however his humor was interspersed with truly insightful and deeply meaningful (sometimes emotional) discussions on the hardships and care he has had for not only for the people of our nation, but all people ‚Äî the women and children harmed as we left Afghanistan, the challenges for those impacted by our border challenges with Mexico, and the anger experienced on 9/11. Making me realize just how much broader our perspectives need to be.

‚≠êÔ∏è Mexico‚Äôs former President, Vicente. Fox discussing the opportunity for nearshore resourcing ‚Äî so true, and I am working with companies in Utah that are building strong workforces based in Mexico and see how much we could expand in this arena.

‚≠êÔ∏è Former Prime Minister of Canada Stephen Harper was insightful on trade economics, and not onboard with any of the current proposed Utah National Hockey League (NHL) team names. (I tend to agree and truly hope ‚ÄúYeti‚Äù does not stick!)

‚≠êÔ∏è Recognition of the incredible impact Scott Anderson has made to our state presented by our current Governor Spencer Cox along with prior Governors Gary Herbert, Jon Huntsman and Michael Leavitt

‚≠êÔ∏è Meeting with Derek Kitchen, prior State Senator and current Sr. VP & Deputy Director Congressional on the work happening within Export-Import Bank of the United States and FireFly Automatix, Inc.

‚≠êÔ∏è UVU President Astrid S. Tuminez interview with Richard Haass created awareness of the sensitivity of our global relations, the risks, and our role in becoming  informed. Having a marine son stationed in Okinawa these conversations become all too real, and his direct calls to action were welcomed (I did leave having bought 2 of his books.) üòÇ

‚≠êÔ∏èListening to Macky Sall reminded me of my time spent in Senegal  üá∏üá≥ in 2016 and saw first hand the impact of small investments being turned into massive change across the country. My time there was the foundation of the work I am now doing at Tech-Moms .

‚≠êÔ∏èWrapping up with Bear Grylls hyping us up and helping us face failure & fear with fire üî•

Utah truly has placed themselves at the forefront of global engagement enabling future growth. We are all changing the world in our own way, and left informed and inspired.  Well done.

#utah #worldtradecenter #zionsbank #global #worldstage Zions Bancorporation

column2:
It seems like today when you ask people how they are doing they always say ‚Äúbusy.‚Äù It‚Äôs as if ‚Äúbusy‚Äù in and of itself were the goal. Here‚Äôs what an AI search had to say about ‚Äúbusy‚Äù : Being busy doesn't always mean you're productive or making progress towards your goals. Being busy can be a state of constant motion without a clear purpose or direction. It can involve juggling multiple tasks without making significant headway in any one area. Being productive, on the other hand, is about making effective use of your time to generate results and move closer to your objectives.

Let‚Äôs get unbusy and get focused.
So excited to have PHP of Northern Indiana join the Priority Health and Corewell Health family. Welcome to all of the team members at PHPNI. I look forward to our journey together!

Recognize BIG moments!

At one of my son‚Äôs recent high school graduation, I was inspired hearing the wonderful ambitions so many young men and women are pursuing.

If I had known then what I know now, here are a few things I would tell new graduates:

1-The best opportunities for you may be far from home; pursue them now before other family and life demands grow in complexity.

2-Stay in contact with your good high school friends over the many years ahead; long friendships can be among the richest and they will eventually need you, and you them.

3-It sounds like everyone has a plan and their life is all perfectly mapped out while you are left behind trying to figure things out. They don‚Äôt. Move forward and make each achievement a building block for the next one.

4-If there was a special someone you always wanted to date in high school but didn‚Äôt, ask them out now. You‚Äôre out of high school and nobody cares anymore.

5-Your parents are suddenly much smarter now than they have been the past four years you were in high school. Ask for their advice and actually listen to it.

6-If you stay in shape, you‚Äôll never have to get back into shape.

7-The best employers look for talent, then passion, and then personality. Develop those, and you will always be in demand.

8-The decisions you now make over the next four years of your life will determine much of what the rest of your life looks like. Shoot for the stars and don‚Äôt settle for subpar.

9-If you didn‚Äôt like the ‚Äúbox‚Äù that you were in or known for during high school, change it now. You write your present and future however you want it.

10-Thank your teachers and coaches every time you see them from now on. Decades from now you will still be quoting them and doing those same drills they had you do with your children‚Äôs teams that you coach!

The future is bright for all 2024 graduates and here‚Äôs to wishing you the very best of success!!

#graduation #advice

This month ‚Äì and every day ‚Äì I am grateful for colleagues across Optum who are dedicated to delivering a differentiated care experience for those we serve, including the LGBTQ+ community.

One such experience is the Pride+ Care program offered through Atrius Health (part of Optum). This comprehensive program takes the specialized care team‚Äôs longstanding commitment to providing personalized care a step further, integrating high-quality, adult primary care with varied specialty health services to better meet the unique needs of LGBTQ+ patients.

Each person‚Äôs needs and goals are distinct - and it is my hope that together, we continue to create more spaces and experiences in health care where everyone feels welcomed, safe, respected and heard. In honor of Pride Month, please join me in acknowledging and celebrating the diversity, histories and lived experiences of the LGBTQ+ community. #pridemonth #optumhealth

This year we welcomed more than 700 early-career team members from across UnitedHealth Group - our largest group yet, with participants joining from 29 different U.S states as well as Ireland.

Technology is essential to our mission at Optum Health and our industry‚Äôs calling ‚Äì and the potential is enormous!

Last week, we experienced the ultimate Consumer Health Care ‚Äì focused event, The inaugural Optum üí•"ConsumerCon‚Äùüí•, where our teams of Product, Engineering, Design, Business and Operations collaborated to create outstanding digital experiences, and shape the future of customer-focused healthcare experiences ‚ö°üß°‚ö° .
A huge THANK You to the cross UnitedHealth Group teams and leaders who came together to make this happen!

The two-day event was full of insights and learnings. Here are some of the highlights:
üß° Rita Khan and I jointly shared the need for a unified consumer digital strategy, essential digital capabilities, and the value of data-driven insights.
üß° Sandeep Dadlani shared valuable advice on how to avoid pitfalls that hinder a culture of fast innovation and growth at scale.
üß° Professor Peter Fader led discussions on customer lifetime value and its power in creating the most important experiences for our members and patients
üß° Katie Schumacher and Jared Carr led a session to identify solutions for key consumer pain points, and shared their ‚Äúwhy‚Äù .
üß° Chris Hanson turned product development into a fun, agile-building exercise with Lego models (who would have thought?)
üß° Terry Clark showed us why it matters to advocate for solutions that meet individual healthcare needs.
üß° Robbi Thatcher moderated a panel that brought insight from consumer advocates, who inspired all of us to be closer to our customers.
üß° And finally, we engaged in a ‚Äúdesign jam‚Äù with Anna Stoesz, Cindy Tam, and Bridget Feickert to learn more about rapid prototyping, the role of research, and top UX trends that emphasize iteration to support a continuous experience evolution.

A heartfelt thank you üôè to everyone involved in organizing ConsumerCon.!!

I continue to hold two different views of AI - I see the benefits and potential but also the downside.  If you only see the benefits and get sucked into the hype, you can run into trouble.  If you only focus on the downside, you potentially miss out on the benefits.  I want to leverage the good while mitigating the downsides - which means understanding it and making sure your staff understand it and have formal responsible use guidelines and training.

That's why I read both critical and praising articles/reviews about AI, especially AI product releases. And, also put my hands on it myself to experience with benefits and drawbacks.

This a critical review of chatGPT4o and worth a read. The author points out the demo was a "preview" of advanced features being tested in controlled ways. The actual product release did not have all the features calling it a "bait and switch."  That's hype.  He compared it to product releases like mobile phones that show features in release demos that are actually in the product release.

"This tactic, in which A.I. companies promise wild new features and deliver a half-baked product, is becoming a trend that is bound to confuse and frustrate people . . . With artificial intelligence, companies are giving a preview of a potential future, demonstrating technologies that are being developed and working only in limited, controlled conditions. A mature, reliable product might arrive ‚Äî or might not."

He goes onto review the new features or "improvements" that were in the product release.He shares a couple of detailed examples of the common problem with LLMs, even this new improved version: hallucinations.  The models provide outright or subtle wrong answers or made up answers reinforcing the need to really check its work and not fall asleep at the wheel.

This article reminds us that when companies rush to release half-baked product, users are the product.  OpenAI said its iterative approach to updating ChatGPT allowed it to gather feedback to make improvements. ‚ÄúWe believe it‚Äôs important to preview our advanced models to give people a glimpse of their capabilities and to help us understand their real-world applications,‚Äù the company said in a statement.

The bottom line from this review:

A major thing OpenAI got right with ChatGPT-4o is making the technology free for people to try. Free is the right price: Since we are helping to train these A.I. systems with our data to improve, we shouldn‚Äôt be paying for them.
The best of A.I. has yet to come, and it might one day be a good math tutor that we want to talk to. But we should believe it when we see it ‚Äî and hear it.

Would love to hear your thoughts.

John Kenyon George Weiner Kaz McGrath Rachel Kimber, MPA, MS Meenakshi (Meena) Das Tim Lockie Allison Fine Susan Mernit Deb Stuligross

Looking back at her teenaged self when she had been recently diagnosed with acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL), Emily Browne she says she was the direct beneficiary of the advances St. Jude has made in methotrexate pharmacodynamics and the pursuit to replace cranial radiation with intrathecal therapy. Now two decades into her career at St. Jude and nearly 29 years since her diagnosis, Browne shares her story in honor of National Cancer Survivors Day. 

‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt know it then, but my journey to St. Jude began September 11, 1995, when I was diagnosed,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúAs a 17-year-old, I didn‚Äôt know what ‚Äúoncology‚Äù meant, only that my pediatrician was concerned about my lab results and persistent fever. I found myself in a clinic in my hometown of Birmingham surrounded by children with cancer, oblivious to the fact that I was about to become one of them.‚Äù 

Fast forward and Browne began in a dream job in a clinic at St. Jude. It was then she began to understand and appreciate the enormous impact that St. Jude researchers like Dr. Ching-Hong Pui and countless others had on advancing the cure rates and improving the quality of life of all children with cancer, including herself. Over the past 20 years, she has worked in a variety of capacities at Jude ‚Äì from Leukemia & Lymphoma to nursing, and now the Transition Oncology Program.  As director of the fledgling program, Browne offers her perspective, knowledge and experience to better understand the psychosocial and physical health needs of patients and families as they transition off cancer-directed therapy and for the next few years of early survivorship. 

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been amazing to experience different career paths without ever leaving St. Jude,‚Äù she says, ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt imagine working anywhere else!‚Äù 

Today we celebrate Emily Browne and other cancer survivors around the country and inspire those recently diagnosed.

The diary of a leader on a Friday: 
I am honored to call these three comrades. 


Bill Russell, Sarah Richardson and Drex DeFord are three inspiring leaders who are (in real-time up here in Napa this week) showing me what relational leadership looks like.

So dear diary, I‚Äôm simply grateful today.

Wow, two years at St. Jude Children's Research Hospital. Working at St. Jude as its director of internal communication has been the most rewarding and challenging (in a good way) experience of my career. I have never worked for an institution that is so laser focused on its mission and culture. The strategic planning of St. Jude and our Strategic Communication, Education and Outreach (SCEO) team is also world class and guides me every day. Cheers to our bright future, my internal communication team (you rock) and many more years of elevating the employee experience at St. Jude.

Generative artificial intelligence can have positive applications in the healthcare industry, said Keith Perry, Senior Vice President and Chief Information Officer, when he spoke recently at the annual Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) Discover conference. The event, held in Las Vegas, is a technology showcase held for HPE business and government customers. 

During the session, Perry said he and his staff see key training opportunities in respect to AI that work to enhance the productivity of highly skilled clinical, research, and administrative professionals. These groups all need to have both a grasp on the evolution of AI, as well as how it can and will impact their respective operations. 

To help advance our knowledge and discovery of pediatric diseases, St. Jude built a GenAI framework to integrate deep learning models into data science programs. The effort supports the institution's ongoing strategic investments in data science, which date back to the Pediatric Cancer Genome Project which at the time was the largest investment and most comprehensive effort to identify and understand the genetic origins of cancer. 

Perry was also recently honored by Becker's Healthcare‚Äôs 2024 ‚ÄúCIOs to know‚Äù list, which recognizes IT executives at health systems and hospitals throughout the U.S. who are leading strategic initiatives, implementing new electronic health record systems, enhancing cybersecurity and deploying telehealth services. Congratulations, Keith! 

#HPEDiscover #GenerativeAI #HealthcareInnovation #StJude #PediatricCancer

Congratulations to Pat Keel, EVP-Chief Administrative and Financial Officer, for being honored on the Becker‚Äôs Healthcare 2024 ‚ÄúCFOs to know‚Äù list. The annual list recognizes leaders for health systems and hospitals throughout the U.S. who are instrumental in strategic financial planning, expansions and joint ventures for their institutions and are key to the organization‚Äôs overall success. 

Keel has served as CFO for St. Jude since 2016 and was promoted to her current role in 2020. Overseeing multiple departments, her responsibilities include managing finance, supply chain, reimbursements, revenue cycle, managed care contracting and grants. 

She was instrumental in the formation and implementation of Women in Leadership & Learning program, the development of St. Jude Global's regional hubs, Workday implementation and go-live, and assisted in the overall implementation of the institution‚Äôs six-year strategic plan. 

Thank you, Pat, for all you do to keep St. Jude striving for new heights. 

#StJude #Hospital #Finance

Had the incredible opportunity to sit on the panel at the WEN Executive Breakfast during the WEN Conference in Atlanta last month. üåü

I shared my thoughts on how culture is the essence of how we operate and interact within our environment. Leadership can set the vision and direction, but it's our teams that truly drive the culture forward. Cultural growth and change emerge from the collective actions, attitudes, and behaviors of individuals across all levels of the organization.

As leaders, our role is to create an environment that empowers and inspires our teams to embody the desired culture and conditions for success. By fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and inclusivity, we can create a thriving workplace where employees feel valued, engaged, and motivated.
Thank you to everyone who attended and contributed to such a meaningful discussion!

#WENConference #Leadership #CorporateCulture #Collaboration #Innovation #Inclusivity #Teamwork #Reworld #ReworldWaste #ReimagineYourWorld #SustainableWasteSolutions #CircularEconomy #EnvironmentalJustice #Sustainability #ESG #CircularEconomy #ZeroWaste #CSuiteBestie #TequilaSmith #BlackWomenLeaders

Georgia, we DID it! 
 
Thirty-two years ago, I was an engineer here at Plant Vogtle, designing valves, piping systems and running turbine vibration testing. It has been a moving and inspirational experience this week to be back on this site, commemorating Units 3 & 4 ‚Äî and celebrating Plant Vogtle as the largest generator of clean energy in the U.S. Georgia did what no one else has been able to do in decades ‚Äì bring two newly constructed nuclear reactors into operation to serve customers. 
 
It was AWESOME to come together with so many leaders from across the state ‚Äì including our co-owners, Governor Brian Kemp, members of the Georgia Public Service Commission and other elected officials ‚Äì to celebrate this historic achievement. On behalf of the thousands of employees and craft labor who have worked on this project, we are so thankful to our partners who were steadfast, loyal and strong ‚Äî partners who worked together with us through challenges and successes along the way. We were excited to host our first-ever AI Summit in Miami, which brought together Thoma Bravo senior leaders, our portfolio company executives, academics and industry experts to discuss the #genAI revolution and its potential to transform enterprise software companies.
 
Our Founder and Managing Partner, Orlando Bravo, reiterated how we've guided our portfolio companies through digital transformation over decades ‚Äì from on-premise to subscription, subscription to cloud, proprietary to open source ‚Äì and we believe we‚Äôre at the forefront of unlocking new opportunities with #AI's transformative technology.
 
‚ÄúThis is an amazingly powerful technology, and with the right people and the right innovators in our companies, we can do even greater things with AI. We also believe that the companies that get governance and trust right with their customers are going to be the ones who win, and so we are focusing on governance to help maximize the growth opportunity and potential of this new technology,‚Äù our Managing Partner Seth Boro also shared.
 
We appreciated the insights from AI experts and our portfolio company executives at Circle Cardiovascular Imaging, Coupa Software, Instructure, Medallia, Ping Identity and Sophos. AI is becoming a core technology, and we are excited about its capability to bring meaningful benefits to our portfolio companies and their customers.

This chart about the costs of training AI large language models (LLMs) caught my attention. Economic theory‚Äîparticularly in the technology industry‚Äîhas long suggested that supply-side innovation can cause prices to fall rapidly for critical infrastructure, even with increasing demand. Think of computer hardware and semiconductor chips as prime examples. 

Gordon Moore, the co-founder of Intel, saw that theory in action. Moore observed that as the number of transistors on a computer chip doubled over a period of about 18 months, the price of the chip over the same period fell by about half. That was way back in 1965‚Äîand the so-called ‚ÄúMoore‚Äôs law‚Äù for chip progress and pricing has continued to hold roughly true for the nearly six decades since (a veritable eon in the tech world). But fast forward to 2024, and generative AI seems to be turning Moore‚Äôs law on its head: costs of training the next generation of LLMs aren‚Äôt halving; instead, prices have roughly doubled every nine months. 

So what explains this reversal? It‚Äôs all about how LLMs scale.

To date, many of the AI race‚Äôs main drivers have seemed to be hyper-fixated on scaling up the existing architecture. Many LLM champions believe that to get to where AI wants to go, ‚Äúscale is all you need‚Äù. Just make the transformer models bigger and more powerful, their thinking goes, and LLMs will revolutionize the economy and‚Äîfor some‚Äîlead to artificial generalized intelligence. That view is why frontier model company CEOs talk about numbers like $10-billion training costs for a model and a $100-billion supercomputer.
 
But today, I‚Äôm hearing more and more about scaling down. In stark contrast to LLMs, the small language model (SLM) ‚Äútheory‚Äù is that smaller models, more tightly engineered for narrower applications and domains, will increasingly supplant LLMs. The same way that fine-tuned four-cylinder engines in a modern BMW 4 series outperform (more horsepower with better gas efficiency) the V8 450-cubic-inch engines that used to power Corvettes. SLMs are also typically trained on finely curated high-quality data sets‚Äîanalogous to the high-octane gas that the four-cylinder engine needs to use. As such, the costs of SLMs may map more closely to¬†Moore‚Äôs law than their large-language counterparts. 

For the moment, developers and investors are essentially betting on both of these theories‚ÄîLLMs and SLMs‚Äîsimultaneously. However, that probably won‚Äôt continue forever in the same fashion. 

‚ÄúScale-is-all-you-need‚Äù LLMs will have to demonstrate extraordinary ROI to justify their $100-billion price tags, while SLMs will have to prove that they are flexible enough to fit multiple use cases and continue to improve their efficiency at domain-specific tasks. Companies adopting AI will also need to decide when they need a fine-tuned BMW and when they need a powerhouse Corvette. 

I believe this is one of the most fascinating and consequential races in the AI world right now‚Ä¶and one to watch closely.

Just finished an interview with CNBC at SuperReturn in Berlin, where we discussed opportunities in enterprise software and how GenAI will revolutionize the software sector. At Thoma Bravo, we see AI as an opportunity, not a threat, and software incumbents are in a great position to benefit from this technology. 

Over the years, we've seen enterprise #software evolve from the limitations of on-premise to the flexibility of SaaS, and now, GenAI is set to redefine business operations. We're actively embracing #GenAI's transformative power and are already seeing products emerge within our portfolio companies. Focusing on #AI is more important than ever, and we're excited and optimistic about what this means for the future of enterprise software.

Cannes Lions International Festival of Creativity Lions is a wrap, and Smartly came to play. Here's a glimpse into our week of sparking industry love and creative revolution, anchored by our campaign of Falling back in love with advertising again:

We kicked off the week with a powerful article from Laura Desmond:
"Reinvention is at the heart of advertising, from the age of media to the rise of AI, our industry has constantly adapted. We dared to transform Cannes in 2005, and the data-driven, programmatic era followed. But consumers are telling us the experience is broken: irrelevant ads, exploding production costs, and a lack of privacy. It's time to fall in love with advertising again. We need to bring creative, media, and intelligence together to create meaningful experiences that power brand love and performance. Brands that tightly connect creative with media, think full-funnel, and leverage AI will win." 

Our First Smartly Branded Cannes HQ: We brought the Smartly vibe with a stunning Croisette view from our penthouse rooftop, hosting industry legends across holdco‚Äôs platforms, brands and sports & fueling passionate conversations about the power of technology to power creativity. #FallInLoveWithAdvertisingAgain

Tech + Creativity = ‚ù§Ô∏è: We championed the power of creative technology to reignite brand love and unlock growth. Smartly is the bridge between the fragmented landscape and a future of storytelling that's both creative & impactful.

Global Thought Leaders: From global creative leaders Rob Reilly, Alexandre Abrantes, Jo Shoesmith, Claudine Cheever, Chaka Sobhani, to storytellers like Double Oscar Winner Ben Proudfoot, we hosted insightful talks that challenged the status quo and ignited a passion for innovation.

The Business of Women‚Äôs Sports Take Center Stage: We spotlighted the booming business of women's sports with two powerful panels including Thayer Lavielle, Heather Hopkins Freeland, Flaujae Johnson, Angela Ruggiero, Jessica Berman, Meg Linehan. Smartly sits at the heart of the social & streaming channels driving this growth. #InvestInHer

Leaving Cannes, we're energized to lead the charge towards a future where intelligent creative fuels brand love and growth. The best is yet to come! #SmartlyatCannes2024 #CannesLions2024

P.S. Big thanks to Cheerful Twentyfirst 21 for bringing our vision to life!

Yesterday, the Chicago Red Stars hosted a Women‚Äôs Sports Panel at Wrigley Field on the Business of Women‚Äôs Sports and investing in women & the amazing professional athletes across the Pro Sports Landscape.

I am proud to be an investor in the Chicago Red Stars, and see Owner, Laura Ricketts & Team President, Karen Leetzow do amazing and inspiring things to lead this team to great heights.

Here are a few inspiring quotes from yesterday‚Äôs panel:

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs up to us by purpose  to invest in Women‚Äôs Sports and shine a light on what women can do.‚Äù Laura Ricketts 

‚ÄúA big difference I see in terms of investing in women‚Äôs sports, is how social media and streaming showed the data that viewership, engagement and interest was there in the women‚Äôs game.  This was a big shift and compelled investors and media companies to take a fresh look‚Äù.   Ally Wagner (Bay FC Founder & former USWNT Soccer Player).

‚ÄúWe have the platform to bring women‚Äôs sports to every HH in the US.  We think Women‚Äôs sports is a great business and we want to lead the media industry in championing it‚Ä¶..part of the problem is there is audience for the games but you can‚Äôt find enough of the product on air‚Ä¶..we‚Äôre going to change‚Äù. Brian Lawlor (President Scripps Sports)

So - if you are in the Chicago Area, come watch history as the Chicago Red Stars take on Bay FC.  And if you can‚Äôt be at Wrigley, then watch on ION tonight.
PARTNERSHIP LOVE

Women‚Äôs Sports Merch is BIG BUSINESS!

Utilizing a balanced analysis of both first party transactional data and custom survey data, we estimate that the women‚Äôs sports merchandise market to be valued at $4Billion. This number takes into account the current rate of women‚Äôs sports fans buying merch, fans seeking merch, average spend on merch, and those who said they would buy more if it was available.

Brought to life by the smarter flexible payments network Klarna and Sports Innovation Lab, ‚ÄúRep Her: Revealing the Unmet Demand Demand for Women‚Äôs Sports Merchandise,‚Äù is the latest research report from The Fan Project, and is available for download. #RepHer

2x Oscar winner Ben Proudfoot x Laura D at Cannes. Ben Proudfoot is debuting two short films at Cannes - L‚ÄôOreal and LinkedIn. 

Storytelling has always been the foundation of creativity in advertising. 

Short film is showing the way for short form video which is growing exponentially versus display online. 

As social x entertainment convergence increases it is likely Netflix and Facebook or Instagram will look more like each other.  A platform where people can go to connect, discover, buy and be entertained all in one experience. This is something brands and agencies need to consider thoughtfully. 

What is Ben‚Äôs approach to storytelling in short form film and how has this led to two back to back Academy Awards?

What role does short film play in a brand‚Äôs messaging and content strategy in the future?

This and more. Join us Monday afternoon.

column2:
Proud¬†to be a part of last night's record-breaking crowd at Wrigley Field for the Chicago Red Stars match!
 Ô∏è
The energy and passion of the fans were undeniable. Even with rain and chilly temps, we shattered the National Women's Soccer League (NWSL) attendance record ‚Äì a true testament to the incredible Chicago sports and soccer community!

This wasn't just about the game; it was about seeing young fans cheering for their heroes, experiencing the magic of Wrigley Field for the first time. 
It was about the pre-game energy at Gallagher Way, the shared passion of friends, colleagues, and the entire league.

Huge shoutout to Laura Ricketts and Karen Leetzow for their vision and hustle in making this historic event happen in just under two months!¬†And of course to the incredible National Women's Soccer League (NWSL) with a special shout to Julie Haddon & Jessica Berman. And major props to the Red Stars staff who tirelessly worked behind the scenes to ensure a smooth night.

This is a night women's soccer and women's sports in general won't soon forget. #ChicagoRedStars #NWSL #HistoryMade

column2:
Forget much of what you thought you knew about what consumers want to see from advertising üõë 

Our new research, launched at Cannes Lions International Festival of Creativity deep dives into how people across generations & demographics want brands to show up across their brand experience journey. Here are a few highlights:

‚Ä¢When consumers are in the discovery phase, production quality of the ad is 2x more important than the product featured, alone.

‚Ä¢Mirroring Gen Z's preferences, 52% of Gen Alpha gravitate towards short- form videos between 2-5 minutes. However, longer content isn't entirely out of favor.

‚Ä¢In the Mid Funnel Consideration phase, consumers want to see Product, Product, Product. Product information is 2.4x more effective than price and promotion. 

‚Ä¢Price and promotions are not in the top five most important creative considerations during the Discovery & Consideration phases of their brand experience journey.

‚Ä¢Only at the purchase phase of the brand experience journey, do consumers rate the actual product offer the most important. Product is 1.6x more important than production which is rated #1 in the Discovery phase.

‚Ä¢While affordability remains a consideration, product information trumps price promotions when influencing purchase decisions.

People are looking for a journey, not a sales pitch. They want brands to guide them from discovery to consideration to action, with creative messaging that truly resonates.

Read the report and learn what truly matters to today's consumers + what winning creative across the funnel looks like üëá

There's a common assumption that there isn't an audience for women's sports apparel.

But that "is absolutely not true," said Klarna's Megan Gokey. And it's costing the companies that make and sell merch ‚Äî as well as teams and leagues ‚Äî as much as $4 billion a year, according to a new data analysis by Klarna and the Sports Innovation Lab released Wednesday.

In addition to calculating the value of the largely untapped market, a study from the Sports Innovation Lab found 60% of women‚Äôs sports fans have wanted to buy merchandise but couldn‚Äôt because of a lack of inventory.

‚ÄúThere's a big market here and, like everything else in women's sports, it has been underserved, misunderstood and there's things we can do to fix it very easily,‚Äù Angela Ruggiero, the Hall of Fame ice hockey player who is co-founder of Sports Innovation Lab, told USA TODAY Sports.

Read more from Nancy Armour:

2x Oscar winner Ben Proudfoot x Laura D at Cannes. Ben Proudfoot is debuting two short films at Cannes - L‚ÄôOreal and LinkedIn. 

Storytelling has always been the foundation of creativity in advertising. 

Short film is showing the way for short form video which is growing exponentially versus display online. 

As social x entertainment convergence increases it is likely Netflix and Facebook or Instagram will look more like each other.  A platform where people can go to connect, discover, buy and be entertained all in one experience. This is something brands and agencies need to consider thoughtfully. 

What is Ben‚Äôs approach to storytelling in short form film and how has this led to two back to back Academy Awards?

What role does short film play in a brand‚Äôs messaging and content strategy in the future?

This and more. Join us Monday afternoon.

It's fantastic seeing the progress we‚Äôve made towards our goal of using #AI to bring 1,000 of the world‚Äôs most spoken languages to Google Translate, and the role this plays in helping us at Google to achieve our overarching mission of making the world's information universally accessible and useful. 

AI is already helping to connect billions of people across the globe, from helping people to understand international websites, to giving holidaymakers the option to veer off the beaten path, to assisting those who need to overcome the language barrier when they first move to a new country. üß≥üõ´

We‚Äôre excited to see this new update will open up more of the world to more peopleüåç.

Cannes Lions International Festival of Creativity Lions is a wrap, and Smartly came to play. Here's a glimpse into our week of sparking industry love and creative revolution, anchored by our campaign of Falling back in love with advertising again:

We kicked off the week with a powerful article from Laura Desmond:
"Reinvention is at the heart of advertising, from the age of media to the rise of AI, our industry has constantly adapted. We dared to transform Cannes in 2005, and the data-driven, programmatic era followed. But consumers are telling us the experience is broken: irrelevant ads, exploding production costs, and a lack of privacy. It's time to fall in love with advertising again. We need to bring creative, media, and intelligence together to create meaningful experiences that power brand love and performance. Brands that tightly connect creative with media, think full-funnel, and leverage AI will win." 

Our First Smartly Branded Cannes HQ: We brought the Smartly vibe with a stunning Croisette view from our penthouse rooftop, hosting industry legends across holdco‚Äôs platforms, brands and sports & fueling passionate conversations about the power of technology to power creativity. #FallInLoveWithAdvertisingAgain

Tech + Creativity = ‚ù§Ô∏è: We championed the power of creative technology to reignite brand love and unlock growth. Smartly is the bridge between the fragmented landscape and a future of storytelling that's both creative & impactful.

Global Thought Leaders: From global creative leaders Rob Reilly, Alexandre Abrantes, Jo Shoesmith, Claudine Cheever, Chaka Sobhani, to storytellers like Double Oscar Winner Ben Proudfoot, we hosted insightful talks that challenged the status quo and ignited a passion for innovation.

The Business of Women‚Äôs Sports Take Center Stage: We spotlighted the booming business of women's sports with two powerful panels including Thayer Lavielle, Heather Hopkins Freeland, Flaujae Johnson, Angela Ruggiero, Jessica Berman, Meg Linehan. Smartly sits at the heart of the social & streaming channels driving this growth. #InvestInHer

Leaving Cannes, we're energized to lead the charge towards a future where intelligent creative fuels brand love and growth. The best is yet to come! #SmartlyatCannes2024 #CannesLions2024

P.S. Big thanks to Cheerful Twentyfirst 21 for bringing our vision to life!

Today, President Biden welcomes President Ruto of Kenya for a State Visit and Dinner to celebrate and deepen ties between our two nations, marking years of official U.S.-Kenya partnership.¬† The two leaders‚Äô agenda includes enhancing our partnership on clean energy and resilience, which includes deepening U.S.-Africa Nuclear Industry Cooperation. 

To further this goal, and as announced in the FACTSHEET, one of the deliverables is that the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) in partnership with Kenya and Ghana, plans to host the second installment of the U.S.-Africa Nuclear Energy Summit (USANES) on Industry Readiness in Nairobi, Kenya, in August 2024. Recognizing the historic relationship between the United States and Kenya, USANES 2024 envisions U.S. and African policymakers, technical experts, and industry leaders convening in Nairobi to address critical issues impacting industry readiness and the future of nuclear energy on the African continent.¬† The Summit comprises educational workshops, stakeholder engagement sessions, and multilateral discussions on topics from financing and workforce development to supply chain preparedness.

(more info: Office of Nuclear Energy, U.S. Department of Energy, Aleshia Duncan, Anushya Ramaswamy)

Are you looking for a new opportunity as an SAP Practice and Delivery Manager?

Join Tachyon Technologies, a global IT services firm specializing in ERP solutions, particularly SAP. Headquartered in Dallas, Texas, USA, we are dedicated to delivering cutting-edge solutions and driving digital transformations for clients worldwide.

We are currently hiring for a full-time position in Hyderabad, India with the option to work remotely.

As the SAP Practice and Delivery Manager, you will lead and manage our SAP practice, providing strategic direction and oversight. You will also oversee the end-to-end delivery of SAP projects, ensuring on-time, on-budget, and high-quality delivery.

If you have extensive experience in SAP practice management and project delivery and a relevant bachelor's degree (a master's degree or MBA is a plus), we would love to hear from you.

column2:
The Game of Life üîΩ

üåü Imagine life as a game - not the kind you win by staying safe, but by how far you‚Äôre willing to run, jump, and sometimes stumble.

üåü It‚Äôs about stepping out of your comfort zone, facing fears head-on, learning from each bump, and growing stronger with every step forward.

üåü It‚Äôs simple, really. Start where you are, use what you have, do what you can. The magic happens when you push a little further each day, dare to do something new, and embrace the uncertainties.

üåü Yes, it‚Äôs scary. But it‚Äôs also where you find new strengths, meet unexpected joys, and discover what you‚Äôre truly capable of.

üåü A comfort zone is a beautiful place ‚Äì but nothing ever grows there!

Did this resonate with you? Would love to hear your thoughts please üëá

It‚Äôs so easy to forget to take care of one of our most valuable assets: mental health. 

When we think of wealth we think about money. But money loses its luster if we‚Äôre not also rich in health.

My husband purchased this book a while back and we‚Äôve tried to read one page of "The Daily Dad" each night. That‚Äôs the concept of the book, to read a page a day for lessons and reminders about parenting. Yesterday's passage was about protecting wealth ‚Äî not in dollars, but mental wealth. It was a great reminder that all the hard work that we do won‚Äôt matter if we‚Äôre drained and mentally exhausted. We can‚Äôt show up for our kids, for others, or ourselves if we‚Äôre not in good health. 

So, as you start your Wednesday, here‚Äôs a cheers to wealth - in all forms!

Recently, I sat down to talk with lots of women about their financial journey and many of the conversations led to what they wished they would have known sooner. 

Reflecting on my own financial journey, I realize now how much small changes can make a huge difference. It's something I wish I had known sooner! From not saving early enough to feeling too embarrassed to ask questions, these are common regrets I've heard from so many women.

In my latest blog post, I share insights from my own experiences and interviews with amazing women. Whether it's understanding tax-deferred savings, leveraging work benefits, or just getting more involved in your finances, there's always room for improvement.

Here's the full blog post with some ideas on how to move forward to start making better decisions today:
üëâ https://lnkd.in/gwRN-Tgw


#FinancialPlanning #WomenAndFinance #FinancialWisdom #InvestInYourFuture #WealthManagement

The End of an Era

This week marks a significant turning point as I've made the decision to leave Coupa Software. This decision is wrapped in immense pride and gratitude to my colleagues (and former colleagues!), customers, partners, industry analysts, and board members from all stages. 

Walking through the Coupa doors 13 years ago, I could never have imagined the phenomenal story we'd create. We started as a fledgling company with a bold vision: to become a Salesforce -like platform for Business Spend Management. We had big dreams and even bigger determination, evident by the post-it notes that adorned our (budget-less) walls!

What followed was phenomenal growth. We grew Coupa from $1 million in recurring revenue into a $1 billion powerhouse. We built a differentiated platform, powered by an innovative community AI model. We cultivated a vibrant customer community with our spirit of ‚Äúensure customer success‚Äù driving our decisions. 

We earned over 100 software patents (24 with my name), secured leadership positions in 150+ analyst reports, and went toe-to-toe with SAP! Along the way, we had an incredible IPO, a meteoric public market rise, and ultimately, a successful Thoma Bravo privatization valued at a staggering $8 billion.

The memories I'll cherish most are the incredible IPO experience, the epic hackathons (even if held in a tiny bank vault!), fun customer advisory boards that embodied the spirit of "none of us is as smart as all of us," the thrilling Great Race-style global sales cycles, and of course, the goofy product videos that hopefully made people outside Coupa laugh as much as they made us laugh in Coupa! 

To the wonderful colleagues (past and present), customers, partners, analysts, and board members that spent so much time collaborating with me personally on this journey, thank you from the bottom of my heart. It‚Äôs been an absolute honor working alongside such brilliant, hardworking, and dedicated people. I could never have played my role in Coupa‚Äôs success without you. I hope our roads cross in the future. 

While my journey at Coupa comes to a close, a new and exciting chapter for me awaits. I'm excited for the next challenge and can't wait to share the details with you all next week! In typical Donna fashion, I start on Monday. üòÄ 

In the meantime, tell me about your favorite Coupa memories below. Let's celebrate the incredible journey we've been on!

 #BSM #Procurement #S2P #CIO #CPO #SpendManagement #AI Rob Bernshteyn Ravi Thakur Raja Hammoud JP Krishnamoorthy David Williams Tony Tiscornia Todd Ford Roger Kaufmann Rob Glenn Steve Winter Fang Chang Arjun Ramaratnam Tara Ryan Tony Wessels Roger Goulart Jon Stueve Mathias Radtke Chandar Pattabhiram Michael Schanker Ray Martinelli Mark Riggs Gabe Perez Leagh Turner Kevin Iaquinto Kevin Burns Sameer Areff Stephen Knipe Craig Newfield Susan Toyama Kevin Iaquinto Neeraj Agrawal Michael V. Ronan Kerouedan Alex Kleiner III Rebecca Morris Dr. Elouise Epstein üè≥Ô∏è‚Äç‚ößÔ∏è

"to be a great SaaS company, you need a Donna"... somebody who lives and breathes the strategy; who energizes those around them to be the best they can be; somebody who touches everything that is success and fixes everything that is not success. Your impact was huge. On Coupa, and on allofus! Congratulations!

With immeasurable gratitude, I share the bittersweet news that Friday was my last day at EcoVadis. It has been a pleasure and an honor to watch the company grow into the indisputable leader in #SustainableProcurement, a market category that just barely existed when I joined nearly seven years ago. 
 
There have been so many remarkable milestones along the way. Working to make Business Sustainability Ratings a mainstream concept. Figuring out how we should pronounce our name (ee-koh-vah-dis)! Driving partnerships and integrations with all the Source to Pay and TPRM colleagues. Developing the eLearning Academy so suppliers could embrace improvement. All seven amazing SUSTAIN events, especially pivoting to an online conference just 10 days after the world locked down in 2020. Supporting two major funding rounds. Establishing critical NPS processes and insights to inform our direction. Creating so much compelling thought leadership that the share of voice is nearly unbelievable. Officially becoming a purpose-led business to ‚ÄúGuide all companies to a sustainable world.‚Äù Helping grow the EcoVadis solution portfolio and network to over 2.4M screened suppliers and 140K+ rated suppliers ‚Äì and revelling as more companies than ever discover Sustain +Ability, getting a rating WITHOUT BEING ASKED ‚Äì because it‚Äôs good business. Partnering closely with sales to achieve 10x+ ARR from 2017 to now. Navigating more acronyms and regulations than I may care to remember üòä. 

And most proudly - building from a team of 5 marketers to over 50, including dozens of nationalities, locations and functions ‚Äì and somehow still creating a tight-knit group that cares deeply for each other while executing like crazy. Working with you all has been an absolute joy. 
 
My sincerest thanks to our co-CEOs, Pierre-Francois Thaler and Frederic Trinel, for this incredible opportunity to cut my teeth as a #CMO - I have learned and grown so much. To my EcoVadis leadership colleagues and all EcoVadians with whom I‚Äôve dived deep day in and day out, thank you for your collaboration, persistence, passion and optimism ‚Äì you are changing the world one company at a time. And to my dear EV marketers ‚Äì thank you for everything - keep innovating and reaching for the stars. I will miss you most. C√©cile Dorvault David McClintock Meena Hans Robert Altman Angie Marcel Daniel Perry

I will keep EcoVadis in my heart and cheerlead your purpose and success always!
 
What‚Äôs next? I‚Äôll be starting on an exciting new journey later in July. Stay tuned for the news but ‚Äì spoiler alert ‚Äì I‚Äôm still a procurement software geek üòä!

#grateful #LifeAtEcoVadis #newbeginnings

This August, I‚Äôll begin my journey towards earning a PhD at Claremont Graduate University, and I could not be more excited!

Someone at work once criticized me I for taking on too much at once. And that stuck with me for a while. So against all my natural tendencies, I deliberately narrowed my professional focus. Not only was it hard, but I was actually LESS productive. You see, ideation is what runs through my veins- it‚Äôs what powers me. Removing my source of inspiration is like taking the engine out of a car and expecting it to run. What I‚Äôve come to realize is that ‚Äútoo much‚Äù is when I am at my best. And incidentally, it‚Äôs when I‚Äôm at my happiest too. 

I look forward to diving deep into research, with the goal of advancing the profession of Resource Management, collaborating with fellow scholars and professionals, and firing on ALL cylinders. üòâ 

I‚Äôll be forever grateful for the encouragement from Paul Robinson, my family, friends, and mentors who have supported me in this new pursuit.

Thank you for being part of my journey. Here‚Äôs to new challenges, growth, and discoveries! Stay tuned for updates on my research and adventures in academia. ‚ú®üéì

#PhDJourney #CGUBound #HigherEducation #ResourceManagement
#FiringOnAllCylinders
